job_description:
Product Manager

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your experience to a world-class company that is market-leading for both content and technology? If yes, we are looking for you!

Join our team & lead definition and planning through production, release, and end of lifecycle.

About the Role

In this opportunity as a Product Manager, you will be responsible to:
• Product launch and post-launch management of new and/or enhanced propositions, products, and/or services, including design, development, and launch activities.
• Participate in or lead cross-functional meetings to ensure on-time, in-scope delivery.
• Create standards, processes, and policies and participate in testing/validation.
• Create proposals or business cases to obtain approval for projects and gain support for new propositions, products, or services.
• Conduct or participate in market and competitive analysis to drive the creation and positioning of propositions, products, or services.
• Supports definition and communication of features and benefits/key selling points and competitive positioning to key stakeholders.
• Develop and execute plans to sunset obsolete propositions, products, or services.
• May support commercial-facing teams in client engagement and retention activities.

About You

You’re a fit for the role if your background includes:
• Bachelor’s degree.
• Fluent English is a must.
• Experience with Mexican Taxes is a must
• Proficiency with Tax Business.
• Familiarity in fiscal/tax solutions.
Demonstrates knowledge of the company’s propositions, products, or services and industry trends.
• Minimum 5 years of experience doing similar activities.

To apply, please upload your updated resume in English.

Location: CDMX

What’s in it For You?

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:
• Hybrid Work Model: We’ve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected.
• Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
• Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
• Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
• Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
• Purpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

#LI-ZM1

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 26,000 employees across more than 70 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

Accessibility

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

Protect yourself from fraudulent job postings click here to know more.

More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on https://thomsonreuters.com.

job_description:
Our Purpose

We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.

Title and Summary

Lead Product Manager -Technical

Job Title
Lead Product Manager – Technical

O&T Market Enablement plays a key role in Localization initiatives around the world. This position will be responsible for leading highly visible projects to meet market and regulatory needs . The ideal candidate is passionate about both understanding the customer & the business, and also working with technology teams to deliver working solutions.
The ideal candidate for this position should:
• Solid analytical skills are essential, i.e. the ability to take high level requirements and drill these down into detailed functional requirements under your own initiative
• Demonstrate the ability to collaboratively, design solutions that both enhance the product offering, and work within the design principles
• Comfortable working at a detailed level with interface specifications & doing related data mappings to and from APIs
• Ability to work collaboratively with development and business stakeholders within an Agile team
• Able to communicate effectively with both business & technical audiences
• Payments experience is a plus but not essential
• Empowerment and accountability
• Collaboration mindset
• Thoughtful risk taking
• Committed to deliver on time and to quality
• Willingness to learn and get stuck in

RESPONSIBILITIES
Overview
Primary responsibilities include overall ownership, accountability, and management of the Mexico switching technical and operational initiatives end to end project plan. Coordinate with cross functional teams (internal and external-ie. Tech vendors) the successful execution of activities as planned and within budget to meet business objectives and go-to-market plans. Assists in business requirements gathering. Identifies key barriers to the project’s success and actively manages mitigation activities and triggers contingency plans. Regularly communicate and present to the project sponsor and senior management the project progress status, risks, mitigation actions, and next steps forward.

Role
Major accountabilities:
• Responsible for managing the overall end-to-end project plan to execute and implement the technology roadmap and all activities related to enabling the operations and running the domestic switch according to the business requirements in collaboration with multiple workstream owners
• Responsible for planning, managing, and tracking deadlines and the development milestones to maintain project stability and achieve successful implementation in releases within agreed upon time, scope and resource requirements
• Responsible for coordinating the activities of the internal cross functional technical teams and vendor technical teams to meet aggressive deadlines of the plan
• Assist Program Manager in the business requirements gathering process
• Must be intimately familiar with the initiatives’ business objectives and scope, as well as the role and function of each team member in order to effectively coordinate the activities of the teams
• Identifies when a project is going off-track and mitigates/remove blockers and impediments that interfere with project progress to guarantee technical and business milestones are met
• Anticipates future project risks, planning gaps and thoroughly prepares contingency plans
• Regularly presents to project sponsor, senior management, and other internal partners the status of the project, risks, mitigation actions and next steps forward

All About You
Knowledge/Experience:
• Must have the experience and ability to clearly understand business goals and translate them into technical and operational implications to plan accordingly
• Extensive knowledge in the areas of planning and project management required processes and techniques
• In-depth knowledge of project planning techniques and automated project planning tools
• Very strong interpersonal skills, including the ability to make effective presentations and communicate technical concepts to non-technical audiences
• Strong knowledge of systems development methods, organizational change management concepts, and business process improvement methods
• Experience working with technical applications and/or information systems, or equivalent
• Knowledge of MasterCard and the payments industry a plus

Critical Skills:
• Must be fluent in English and Spanish (oral and written)
• Strong business acumen
• Organizational, planning and multi-tasking skills
• Strong initiative and relationship-building skills required with a solid track record for developing internal and external relationships
• Listening, oral, written, and presentation skills
• Effective interpersonal skills
• Demonstrate ethics and values to generate high team trust and energy.

Work Conditions:
• Some travel may be required

Corporate Security Responsibility

All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
• Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
• Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
• Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
• Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

job_description:
Teamwork makes the stream work.

Roku is changing how the world watches TV

Roku is the #1 TV streaming platform in the US, and we've set our sights on powering every television in the world. Roku pioneered streaming to the TV. Our mission is to be the TV streaming platform that connects the entire TV ecosystem. We connect consumers to the content they love, enable content publishers to build and monetize large audiences, and provide advertisers unique capabilities to engage consumers.

From your first day at Roku, you'll make a valuable - and valued - contribution. We're a fast-growing public company where no one is a bystander. We offer you the opportunity to delight millions of TV streamers around the world while gaining meaningful experience across a variety of disciplines.

About the team

The International Product Team exists to bring great Roku products and experiences to more TVs around the world. Working with functional experts and strategic leaders, this team will build and execute roadmaps for all aspects of the Roku ecosystem in markets around the world. This team works cross-functionally to understand the needs of our consumers and partners, along with other market opportunities, analyzes data to draw insights and learnings, collaborates on a thoughtful go-to-market plan to drive the success of the latest features, and works hand-in-hand across marketing, sales, merchandising, data science, engineering, and other product teams.

About the role

We are seeking a driven and experienced product expert, focused on the Mexican market, who can understand the overall local entertainment space and develop a clear product vision that helps Roku become the streaming leader in Mexico. 

Successful candidates don’t get roadblocked. They are tenacious and action-oriented leaders who thrive in high-growth environments.  They build consensus, make decisions, and solve problems.   Most importantly, successful candidates set a high standard for quality, advocate for customers, and take ownership of their programs. This consumer-focused and passionate leader will play a critical role in deciding how Roku invests in our consumers.

What you'll be doing
• Work with business partners to build the overall product strategy for Mexico, based on business priorities, customer research, competitive research, and communicates expectations for how this roadmap will lead to Roku winning in the market
• Create and communicate product strategy, roadmap, plans, and progress to stakeholders
• Work across multiple parts of the business and leverage 3rd parties to build an overall understanding of the customers and market in the target country
• Understand, communicate, and test for accuracy predictions on how changes to the overall Roku product offering (including, hardware and software) will impact scale, monetization opportunities, and customer satisfaction
• Develop and test hypotheses on how Roku can be more valuable to a given market
• Work with Roku data teams to ensure we have the data coverage and communication we need to properly understand performance and customer behavior in these markets
• Work with Roku core product teams to get new features for target countries developed, QA'd, launched, and impact-tested
• Contribute to a prioritization framework that can help decide what aspects of the overall roadmap to focus on next in and across target countries
• Bring creative and actionable ideas for how to reach customers and work with engineering and product management to bring them to life

 We’re excited if you have
• 10+ years in Product Management in the consumer electronics or streaming entertainment fields
• Built and executed successful consumer-facing roadmaps in Mexico
• Demonstrated excellence in developing highly successful consumer-facing features from concept through delivery
• Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills; Able to use data to inform roadmaps and prioritization
• Experience working cross-functionally with engineering, marketing, sales, and other product teams
• Experience presenting to customers, executive leaders, and cross-functional teams - possess excellent interpersonal skills, as well as align a diverse set of stakeholders towards a common goal
• Customer empathy to advocate for the right customer experiences
• BS, BA, MBA preferred or equivalent experience

#LI-SR2
Benefits

Roku is committed to offering a diverse range of benefits as part of our compensation package to support our employees and their families. Our comprehensive benefits include global access to mental health and financial wellness support and resources. Local benefits include statutory and voluntary benefits which may include healthcare (medical, dental, and vision), life, accident, disability, commuter, and retirement options (401(k)/pension). Our employees can take time off work for vacation and other personal reasons to balance their evolving work and life needs. It's important to note that not every benefit is available in all locations or for every role. For details specific to your location, please consult with your recruiter.

The Roku Culture

Roku is a great place for people who want to work in a fast-paced environment where everyone is focused on the company's success rather than their own. We try to surround ourselves with people who are great at their jobs, who are easy to work with, and who keep their egos in check. We appreciate a sense of humor. We believe a fewer number of very talented folks can do more for less cost than a larger number of less talented teams. We’re independent thinkers with big ideas who act boldly, move fast and accomplish extraordinary things through collaboration and trust. In short, at Roku you'll be part of a company that's changing how the world watches TV. 

We have a unique culture that we are proud of. We think of ourselves primarily as problem-solvers, which itself is a two-part idea. We come up with the solution, but the solution isn't real until it is built and delivered to the customer. That penchant for action gives us a pragmatic approach to innovation, one that has served us well since 2002. 

To learn more about Roku, our global footprint, and how we've grown, visit https://www.weareroku.com/factsheet.

job_description:
Req ID 65965 Tlaquepaque, Mexico

Position Summary: Product Manager as part of Category Management IAM is responsible for developing the product line assigned to him/her in accordance with the company's strategy. This includes new spare parts introduction, implementation of change management, continuous portfolio adjustments and the responsibility for product master data to achieve specific goals in terms of sales, profitability, capital commitment and market share This is done by following applicable company guidelines and principles, as well as other goals.

Role Expectations:

B2C expertise and service for Independent Aftermarket (IAM). Manage IAM product range offer and its product life cycle. Work cross functional with Engineering, Cataloging, Quality, Marketing, Pricing, Purchasing, Sales and other departments to ensure revenue and customer satisfaction goals are met.

Position Main Responsibilities:
• Drive new product introductions through customer feedback, vehicle research and market/category research.
• Product life cycle management, including range extension, product changes and termination.
• Track and enhance NPI sales efficiency.
• Define product specification, including packaging, label, appearance, inserts.
• Work together with Sales to monitor customer requirements, market and competitor’s trends.
• Furnish purchasing with necessary information to properly RFQ vendors.
• Knowledge and expertise on automotive parts for typical failure modes, service life, and relative advantages between ZF’s products v. competitors.
• Manage the data integrity of the product line in SAP, ensure all necessary information is maintained and accurate.
• Maintain vehicle coverage and profitability of assigned Category according to KPI defined by the company.
• Elaboration of New Announcement letter for Customer communication
• Devising long-term development strategies for product categories
• Perform additional tasks as assigned.

Essential Skills and Experience:
• Mechanical, Industrial and / or Mechatronic Engineering, Business University degree
• 5 years of automotive aftermarket experience desired.
• Ability to prioritize multiple projects and work within deadlines.
• Excellent analytical and technical aptitude
• Excellent project management skills and leadership
• Strong communication skills and the ability to cooperate with multiple departments and companies}
• English Level : Advanced

Be part of our ZF team as Product Management and apply now!

Contact

Alejandra Carbajal

job_description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

EY advises clients to envision, articulate, architect, assess, plan and implement bleeding edge solutions to efficiently run their businesses, with a focus on Digital and Cloud. These service areas span E-commerce, Digital Experience, Mobile Applications, Digital Platforms, Digital Technology Strategy, and Digital IT Operations.

The opportunity

In this rapidly growing area, you will have the opportunity to spread your wings and develop a broad skillset to meet the evolving demands of the digital landscape. Most of your time will be spent embedded with our clients’ team providing a unique business perspective on how to turn strategy into reality while continuing to innovate and remain competitive in ever-changing industries.

Your key responsibilities

As a member of our Digital Functional Leadership team, you will be responsible for understanding, guiding, and executing the strategic direction of digital products for our clients. You will work side by side with the client to translate their strategic vision into reality.

Skills and attributes for success

• Driving the strategic vision and roadmap of a project or product through the creation of specifications, definition and design, including journey maps, flow diagrams, feature map, user stories and/or other critical deliverables

• Mentoring an EY project team, managing relationships within the team and identifying areas of growth to build peers and more junior consultants who can learn the skills necessary to become strong managers and functional leads

• Working in project teams through agreed upon phases of project governance, assessment, requirements definition, vendor selection, risk analysis, customization, testing, training and rollout of a client's project lifecycle

• Driven by quality client delivery for your own work as well as the work of the team, actively participate and provide insight into the team staffing process

• Leading cross functional teams looking at the holistic project effort to meet both business and technical needs

• Working directly with creative, business and technical team members to identify interdependencies and define and document requirements that adhere to technical constraints

• Leading team members in developing applicable methodologies, tools, approaches, points of view, thought leadership and accelerators to differentiate EY in the Digital and Emerging Technology Advisory market

• Providing broad technical and functional knowledge of various key technology and business platforms

• Partnering with client technology professionals, and third-party strategic alliances to solve technical and business challenges

• Collaborating with the client to prioritize the features and user stories developed into an agile backlog; supporting the management of requirements throughout the agile development lifecycle.

• Providing guidance and coaching to client Product Owners on leading practices, coordination with key business stakeholders, as well as supporting completion of planning and day-to-day delivery activities

• Managing communication with executive clients and sponsors

• Organizing and leading pursuit teams; participating in, and leading aspects of the proposal development process

To qualify for the role you must have

• Bachelor's degree and 5 or more years of related work experience

• Minimum 4 years of experience in a digital related field (technology, design, etc.), with at least two years in a leadership role

• Minimum 4 years of experience in project management and product management, including writing user stories, crafting roadmaps, developing functional flows, maintaining a backlog and working with a scrum team

• Strong written and verbal communication, presentation, client service and technical writing skills, coupled with a strong interest in further developing and integrating enterprise business processes with technology skills

• Knowledge of leading practices, benchmarking, peer company environments and prior consulting experience relevant to industry specific business and technology functions

• Ability to lead a team, balance multiple tasks, meet deadlines, and adapt to changes in requirements

• Ability to analyze business requirements, identify gaps and define solutions to address complex business challenges

• Ability to deftly identify, manage, and track dependencies across teams and projects to manage risk

• Experience with agile or other development methodology

• Ability to travel up to 80%

Ideally, you’ll also have

• Prior consulting experience highly preferred

• Experience leading cross-functional teams on large digital transformation initiatives

• Experience creating and owning relationships with client executives and strategic partners

What we look for

We’re interested in passionate leaders with a strong vision and a desire to stay on top of trends in the Digital and Emerging Technology space. If you have a strong passion for helping businesses achieve their digital strategy, this role is for you.

What we offer

We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. The salary range for this job in most geographic locations in the US is $108,600 to $199,100. The salary range for New York City Metro Area, Washington State and California (excluding Sacramento) is $130,300 to $226,300. Individual salaries within those ranges are determined through a wide variety of factors including but not limited to education, experience, knowledge, skills and geography. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.

• Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.

• Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.

• Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.

• Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

EY is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer providing equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, including arrest and conviction records, in accordance with applicable law.

EY is committed to providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability and either need assistance applying online or need to request an accommodation during the interview process, please call 1-800-EY-HELP3, type Option 2 (HR-related inquiries) and then type Option 1 (HR Shared Services Center), which will route you to EY’s Talent Shared Services Team or email SSC Customer Support at ssc.customersupport@ey.com.

job_description:
Clara

Clara is an end-to-end corporate spend management solution for growing businesses in Latin America. Our credit cards and spend management solution are already being used by thousands of top companies in Mexico, Brazil, and Colombia.

We’re backed by the leading regional and global investors, such as Coatue, DST Global, monashees, Kaszek, Canary, Picus Capital, Avid Ventures, A*, Box Group, SOMA Capital, SV Angel, and dozens of angel investors including some of the most successful founders in LatAm and the world. We’ve reached a unicorn valuation in record time and have been recognized as a Great Place to Work and a LinkedIn Top Startup.

We’re creating the future of how company finances are run and helping our customers be more successful. We aspire to empower companies to operate with agility and financial clarity, ultimately increasing the economic competitiveness of Latin America. We’re looking for the best talent in the region (and beyond) to join us on this journey.

We are looking for someone who will:
• Coordinate across teams to create and implement a decisive project plan and strategy from product development to launch
• Act as the key authority and point of contact for project development concepts, business strategy, and business models
• Partner with the Marketing, Engineering, and Design teams to bring the product vision to life with prototypes and mocks
• Ensure that various stages of product development are completed on time by leading, organizing, and requesting constant updates from cross-functional teams
• Collect, analyze, and report on data; make adjustments to development plans as needed to facilitate a successful new product roll-out
• Understand and guide products by knowing the spaces and opportunities in the market
• Represent the voice of the end consumer throughout the development process
• Ensure that high standards of reliability, quality, usability, and measurement are adhered to throughout each phase of product development

Our requirements for the job:
• 5+ years of relevant work experience in product management
• Previous experience with startups and product lifecycle
• Strong leadership and interpersonal skills
• Passion for conceiving, creating and designing useful, innovative products
• Experience identifying various business problems or product flaws and coming up with creative solutions
• Solid understanding of web and mobile technologies, service operations at scale, and ability to go deep in technical areas
• Ability to explain technical vision, roadmap, key solutions and technical architectures to all types of stakeholders
• Growth mindset; drive to stay up to date with changes to enterprise technology
• The ability to wear many hats, learn quickly and change direction when needed
• Innate curiosity and ability to self-start in an ambiguous and rapidly-changing startup environment
• Proven track record of delivering on team revenue or usage targets
• Fluent in Spanish and English
• Previous experience with startups and product lifecycle
• Great customer-facing skills including the ability to rapidly establish and maintain personal and organizational credibility with Customers and Partners through deep delivery knowledge
• Bachelor or advanced degree in Engineering or Computer Science or equivalent work experience

Values

The way we do things is as important as what we do. That is why we operate on a set of carefully developed virtues. This is what we expect from ourselves and each other to make our culture stronger by applying these values in our day to day work.

We value
• Clarity - Open and direct communication
• Simplicity - Pare things down to the essential
• Ownership - We're all owners and act like it
• Pride - Make quality products we're proud of
• Always Be Changing (ABC) - Continuous self-improvement
• Inclusivity - Every voice counts; we value each other for our shared mission and contributions

Benefits

We offer
• Above market salary
• A robust stock ownership plan to make you an owner
• 100% flexible work model
• A set of flexible benefits, #LifeAtClara, that are adaptable to your way of life and your needs as you evolve:
• Physical health
• Mental Health
• Personal Development
• Economic Development
• Safe and healthy Work Environment
• Family Benefits
• Contribution to the community
• Opportunities for learning and development
• A fast-paced growing environment
• A chance to shape B2B payments in Latin America and increase the region’s economic competitiveness

We are
• Shaping business finances in Latin America
• Driven by our 6 core values
• Proud of our inclusive and caring culture
• Certified as a Great Place to Work and a Top LinkedIn Startup

Clara focuses on SaaS, Finance Technology, and Credit Cards. Their company has offices in Brazil, Chile, Mexico, Colombia, and Peru. They have a large team that's between 201-500 employees. To date, Clara has raised $108.5M of funding; their latest round was closed on December 2021.

You can view their website at https://clara.com or find them on Twitter and LinkedIn.

job_description:
Kunai is a fast-growing digital consultancy focused on banking, payments, and fintech powered by a global network that attracts the best and brightest people from all backgrounds and cultures, driven by innovation and experimentation, spread across almost every single continent. Over the past decade, we've shipped over 150 products for clients that include Visa, American Express, Capital One, WEX, Wells Fargo, Ernst & Young, and TOMS Shoes. Our founders built a previous agency (Monsoon) that was acquired by Capital One in 2015.

WE ONLY WILL CONSIDER CANDIDATES LOCATED IN CDMX OR CANDIDATES WHO WANT TO RELOCATE TO CDMX

This is a remote position but you should go to the offices in Roma Norte sometimes (sporadically).

We are seeking a Product Manager who is excited by emerging technologies and has experience launching enterprise platforms and software. You’ll have the opportunity to be on the forefront of modernizing a banking core that powers over $60 billion in annual transaction volume for over 100 million active payment cards for one of the largest credit card issuers in the world. You will work with a team of Kunai engineers, building microservices that will facilitate the migration of the core itself from a legacy off-the-shelf system to a bespoke, purpose-built one, and actuate simpler core migrations and modernizations for decades to come.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent.
• 4+ years of experience in Product Management.
• Experience bringing enterprise platforms/software to market.
• Familiarity with software development practices, APIs.
• Ability to work as a product evangelist to accelerate adoption across multiple business units.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Preferred Qualifications:
• Previous experience in an engineering role
• Experience building and launching products in the financial services or payments space.

Benefits:
• 30 Christmas bonus.
• $600 MXN pesos per month internet/stipend.
• 1500 USD/year for continued education.
• All Mexican Federal Holidays.
• 20 Days paid time off.
• Life work balance.
• Life insurance.
• Vision insurance.
• Dental Insurance.
• Medical Insurance inpatient & outpatient.

job_description:
Product Manager for Industrial IEC Motors
Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

Working as a Product Manager, you will be a key member of the marketing and sales team in Motion NEMA and IEC Motors, defining marketing plans, including marketing communication, training and sales initiatives. In this role, you will oversee all steps in the life cycle of products, systems or services, including development, launch, maintenance, pricing and profitability of IEC induction motors in Mexico
This is a position with global grade

13
This position reports to

Marketing & Sales Manager
Your responsibilities
• Driving the profitability and life cycle of products and services by defining pricing guidelines and market position.
• Overseeing inventory levels and sales volumes to ensure ability to meet customer orders, while tracking and analyzing the performance and trends of products and services
• Working closely with R&D to propose and evaluate product feasibility projects and roadmaps for new products and services.
• Providing technical and commercial assistance to the sales team.
• Working closely with the HR team to ensure is properly organized, staffed and directed.
• Guiding, coaching and developing the skills and knowledge of the sales team.

Your background
• Bachelor’s Degree in Electro-Mechanic or Electronic Engineering.
• 5 years of experience in sales and experience with IEC motors and/or electric products sales.
• Market analysis and sales strategy.
• Proficient with Microsoft Office, SAP, Sales Force and Abacus.
• Availability to travel.
• Advanced English level.

More about us

We look forward to receiving your application (documents submitted in English are appreciated). If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com.
Work model: hybrid #LI-hybrid

job_description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?

Are you at the pinnacle of your career, with a decade of experience steering B2B SaaS products toward market success? Are you interested in working at the cutting edge of generative AI, pioneering its application in product development?

Trilogy's portfolio includes over 100 B2B software companies and acquires more every year. In our view, every industry will be disrupted by Generative AI, and all of our products must embrace it. In this role, you will be responsible for setting the GenAI product vision for our entire portfolio of companies. In so doing, you will delve into the customer mindset, involving deep analysis of market trends, customer behavior, and product profitability, and determine how we can leverage GenAI to maximize customer value. Your strategic decisions will significantly influence our products' market positioning and profitability, driving both customer satisfaction and business success.

We're not just looking for a product manager; we're looking for a visionary who’s ready to redefine the standards of product management. If you’re ready for a role where you'll drive real market impact, we invite you to bring your expertise to our team!

What you will be doing
• Align customer and market analysis with strategic objectives, using generative AI to enhance decision-making and efficiency.
• Perform in-depth analysis of product costs, pricings, and customer data to optimize profitability and market positioning.
• Develop and refine Platinum service offerings, incorporating customer feedback and using AI to create exceptional customer experiences.

What you won’t be doing
• Managing the entire product development cycle; your focus will be on high-level strategic planning and decision-making.
• Technical product decisions; these are managed by a specialized team, allowing you to concentrate on the commercial aspects.
• Engaging in constant cross-functional communication; you are the primary decision-making authority.

SVP of Commercial Product Management key responsibilities
• Driving customer retention through strategic service offerings, informed by generative AI to maximize value creation.

Basic Requirements
• At least 7 years of experience in a product management role within a B2B SaaS company
• Experience leveraging AI technologies (such as ChatGPT, Claude, Bard, or Bing) in a product management context (for ideation, strategy formulation, etc.)

About Trilogy

Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.

job_description:
We are looking for an experienced Program Manager to join our leadership team. In this role, you will be expected to drive development for platform features, plan and triage priorities, provide insight on team capacity, and rise to the challenge of balancing business needs while continually improving engineering processes.

This position requires strong leadership, coaching skills, and expert level follow through. You must be able to cut through ambiguity and be comfortable with rapid prioritization/re-prioritization as needed. You will be working with other cross-functional groups that will have varied technical experience, so simple, clear communication is key in this role.

Responsibilities:
• Define & document technical project objectives, scope, and identify dependencies
• Define resource requirements and assist product leadership in allocating resources based on fluctuating priorities
• Report on engineering KPIs & print metrics
• Collaborate with various stakeholders in establishing high-level standards & best practices for delivering software
• Coach engineers to foster healthy team collaboration
• Remove roadblocks & hold a standard of transparent communication
• Works with the product leadership team to educate engineers on how their contributions impact business goals.
• Work with external teams to understand requirements and help form stable and secure solutions to complex problems
• Identify & solve for inefficiencies in engineering processes, processes that touch engineering, and tech
• Listen to and advocate for the Engineering team; work with the leadership team to find & implement solutions to resolve concerns or requests

Required Skills:
• Bachelor's degree in a relevant field
• 5+ years of acquirer/banking experience
• 3+ years experience leading cross-functional software projects
• Experience in leading product development from start to finish
• Ability to see the big picture, while navigating technology and partner development decisions and tradeoffs
• Experience working in an agile/scrum environment
• Advanced verbal and written communication skills to present ideas and concepts effectively.
• Experience of the following is highly desirable: JAVA 1.7 & higher, messaging system, Tomcat, Linux, HTTP, SOAP/REST Web Services, XML, JSON
• Working experience with Middleware architecture such as JMS, Azure Service Bus, GCP Pub Sub etc.
• Good experience with various testing frameworks
• Solid understanding of API and integration design principles
• API focused integration design and patterns experience for the web
• Experience implementing requirements of the API layer like security, custom analytics, throttling, caching, logging, request and response modifications etc. using API management platform.
• Experience with designing and developing API proxies and REST APIs using API Management platform.
• Experience with converting web services from SOAP to RESTful or vice-versa, using API management platforms.
• Knowledge of Agile and DevOps methodologies.
• Significant experience designing, deploying, and supporting production cloud environments, such as Google Cloud (GCP) and private cloud environments.
• Experience creating custom policies in Java, JavaScript, Node JS, Python etc. in API management platforms.
• Expertise in configuring the Apigee Private Cloud platform, including keystores, truststores, and KVMs.
• Ability to apply security, throttling, OAuth 2.0, TLS, certificates, KeyStore, and Trust store for the Apigee platform.
• Experience with CI/CD Tools (Jenkins, GitHub) for Apigee proxies deployment automation.
• Hands-on experience in designing and developing high volume web services using API Protocols and Data Formats (REST, JSON, SOAP & XML).

job_description:
At Johnson & Johnson, we believe good health is the foundation of vibrant lives, thriving communities, and forward progress. That’s why for more than 135 years, we have aimed to keep people well at every age and every stage of life. Today, as the world’s largest and most broadly based healthcare company, we are committed to using our reach and size for good. We strive to improve access and affordability, create healthier communities, and put a healthy mind, body, and environment within reach of everyone, everywhere. Every day, our more than 140,000 employees across the world are blending heart, science, and ingenuity to profoundly change the trajectory of health for humanity.

Diversity, Equity & Inclusion are essential to continue building our history of pioneering and innovation, which has been impacting the health of more than 1 billion patients and consumers every day for more than 130 years. Regardless of your race, belief, sexual orientation, religion, or any other trait, YOU are welcome in all open positions at the largest healthcare company in the world.

When You Join Johnson & Johnson, Your Move Could Mean Our Next Breakthrough.

At Johnson & Johnson Innovative Medicine, we never stop working toward a future where disease is a thing of the past. You can count on us to keep working tirelessly to make that future a reality for patients everywhere, by fighting sickness with science, improving access with ingenuity, and healing hopelessness with heart. We focus on areas of medicine where we can make the biggest difference: Oncology, Hematology, Immunology, Neuroscience, Infectious Diseases and Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension. Visit us: www.janssen.com

We are searching for the best talent for Strategic Affairs Senior Manager to be located in Mexico City, Mexico.

General Summary:

The Strategic Affairs Senior Manager leads the Strategic Affairs Working Group, ensuring alignment between the different functions that form it and the Company’s Strategic Objectives.

comprehensive market access strategy to approach HTA and institutional technology assessment committees to present the evidence regarding a health technology to support decision making by policy makers, key opinion leader’s payers and providers, seeking to maximize access to Janssen’s innovative medicines portfolio in Mexican Institutions.

The following processes and activities fall under the direct responsibility of this position:

Areas of Responsibility:

• Creation and deployment, in coordination with the Communications department, an external narrative for Johnson & Johnson Innovative Medicine around strategic topics related to the value of innovation and access to new therapies.

• Coordinate and manage the external stakeholder engagement plan, ensuring key messages are updated in alignment of strategic objectives.

• Plan and execute key initiatives, liaisoning the Government Affairs, Market Access, Clinical Development, Medical Affairs, Legal, and Communications leaders to maximize Johnson & Johnson Innovative Medicine’s Strategic Affairs’ impact in the external environment.

• Anticipate changes in the external environment that may have regulatory, access, and policy implications for the Company and its Innovative Medicine present and future portfolio.

• Represent the Mexican Organization in the Regional Strategic Affairs Working Group, raising relevant insights and downloading regional strategies to the local organization.

• As a Senior Leader, bring a positive growth mindset to the organization, working with peer leaders in shaping and preparing the Company for the future.

job_description:
Values & Innovation

At Under Armour, we are committed to empowering those who strive for more, and the company's values - Act Sustainably, Celebrate the Wins, Fight on Together, Love Athletes and Stand for Equality - serve as both a roadmap for our teams and the qualities expected of every teammate.

Our Values define and unite us, the beliefs that are the red thread that connects everyone at Under Armour. Our values are rallying cries, reminding us why we're here, and fueling everything we do.

Our pursuit of better begins with innovation and with our team's mission of being the best. With us, you get the freedom to go further - no matter your role. That means developing, delivering, and selling the state-of-the-art products and digital tools that make top performers even better.

If you are a current Under Armour teammate, apply to this position on the Internal Career Site Here.

Purpose of Role

The Sr. Manager, Supply Chain Operations will manage overall end-to-end UA Supply Chain Operations and supervise the Account Services Professionals responsible for servicing Mexico. This Manager must exhibit outstanding customer service and liaise cross-functionally within the Americas & Global Supply Chain organizations concerning all supply chain operations matters and will be a prerequisite to be successful. Maintaining strong communication and team management skills as well as utilizing supply chain knowledge will be a pre-requisite to success.

Establish and preserve strong cross-functional relationships with key stakeholders across the matrix (Global/Reginal/Local). Manage, Motivate, Lead and Support the Department; Supply Chain & Account Service Team to enhance and exceed service expectations; SLA’s and KPI’s by responding to internal and external inquiries and in driving GTM fulfillment strategies by performing the following duties and responsibilities.

Key metrics: Customer Satisfaction, Service, Inventory at Hubs, Dwell Time, Supply Chain Cost as a % of Net Revenue, CPU, Claims & Returns, shipping targets accuracy, Initiatives Implementation and Process Improvement etc.

Your Impact
• Strategic & Supply Chain Management
• Responsible for the correct Order Management Process within the fulfillment process maximizing potential revenue opportunities and leveraging logistic infrastructure within total delivered cost.
• Facilitate SOP Process development to drive standardization and discipline within the Supply Chain and Service organization.
• Responsible for the Inbound flow of goods through the UA supply chain team to Customers.
• Responsible for setting Shipping targets between the Supply Chain, Commercial/Finance and Markets.
• Responsible for the Sales Operations OTC process (Order Book; IRF, URD, Shipping targets)
• Jointly with the America’s and Global Supply Chain Management teams to develop, implement, and execute supply chain & service strategies in line with Regional/local Initiatives.
• Maximize Mexico's net revenues and profitability through optimizing the fulfillment process.
• Develop and maintain a customer and consumer-focused organization (Customer Service, Distribution, Inbound, Outbound, Inventory management, 3PL, Carriers) by applying strong people management skills and business understanding.
• Regularly participate in the country management meetings and build strong working relationships with all functional leads.
• Be actively involved in executing a robust Sales and Operation Planning process (S&OP) that creates a consensus-based forecasting process with cross functional partners, both globally and regionally, and exposes variances to the plans early in the season to anticipate potential issues.
• Own, drive and execute specific Global/Regional/Local supply chain initiatives/projects.
• Account Relationship
• Develop a good understanding of the Mexico business and supply chain capabilities/ opportunities within UA and Customers. Inclusive of holding and leading yearly Top 2 Top meetings.
• Understand and relate to Customers and their needs by building a healthy relationship. Focus on the maintenance and improvement of service levels and end-to-end processes.
• Define process improvement initiatives and projects to support the Global Operations mission to “make Supply Chain a competitive advantage”.
• Establish scalable best practices to improve partnership, UA cost and flow of product through both supply chains. Including a thorough understanding of in-country nuances and exceptions.

Your Impact Continued
• Teammate Engagement & Management
• Lead and manage the Supply Chain & Service team.
• Trains, coaches, motivates, and manages Supply Chain and Account Service Professionals.
• Develop and advance Teammates by creating both team and individualized goals and evaluating their progress and performance.
• Recognize areas in need of operational improvement. Suggest ideas for the development of new procedures and changes in existing processes to increase productivity.
• Inventory / Logistics Management
• Liaise with Regional function leads to manage the following.
• Through the S&OP process, review, and action any capacity/supply challenges impacting regional supply and deliveries. Provide timely information and recommendations on flow, assortments, inventory levels and potential opportunities/ risks.
• Continuously seek for opportunities to improve Inventory turns (product life-cycle management, flows to factories, minimizing early inventories…) impacting positively the Region and Local P&L; maximizing revenue opportunities while minimizing risks and costs (warehousing capacity, transportation issues, financial implications, etc.)
• Lead the Supplier services and deliverables to 3PL.
• Set the standards and control for return logistics and support quality control processes.
• Monitor and optimize the communication of the delivery information and dates.
• Ensure Ecommerce Speed & Service.
• Monitor & evaluate performance, contracts, and Service Level Agreements of all service providers.
• Communication
• This role is extremely cross-functional, they (and their team) will work with supply chain, IT, in-country commercial teams, sourcing, trade compliance, logistics, accounting/tax etc.
• They will also be required to build strong strategic relationship with Wholesale Customers. Internal and external communication is required.
• Proactively communicate by means of meetings, reports, project participation etc. all aspects of business or operations which affect Department, Country, Region or Global Teams.
• Problem Solving and be able to make decisions that reflect good judgment, use creative problem-solving methods to analyze problems, generate options and decide on a course of action that moves the organization toward its goals.

Qualifications

• University Degree

• 5-7 years of leadership experience in Supply Chain Logistics & Customer Service

• Knowledge of Warehouse Management Systems, experience in implementations of ERP, SAP is an advantage and track record in changing environment

• Strong command of written and spoken English and local language.

Workplace Location
• Location: This individual must reside within commuting distance from our Mexico office.
• Return to Work Designation: 3-4 days week in-office, the remainder of work week remote.

Relocation
• No relocation provided

Our Commitment to Diversity

At Under Armour, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, family or paternal status and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Under Armour believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. Accommodation is available for applicants with disabilities upon request.

job_description:
The Team:

We are Datadog's in-house product experts. The technical solutions team enables Datadog's worldwide growth by educating potential clients and ensuring that existing customers are happy and successful. We share our technical and product expertise with customers through demos, presentations, technical evaluations, and ongoing support. Technical solutions is a growing global team that collaborates constantly to share knowledge and continuously advance our technical skillset.

The Opportunity:

Join a diverse team of traditional and non-traditional backgrounds, working together to solve complex problems the right way. You will lead a team immersed in a startup-like environment where you will be challenged, but also will immediately witness your contributions to Datadog.

You Will:
• Manage, develop, and mentor a fast-paced team of Solutions Engineers who respond to client requests, reproduce and troubleshoot issues, and dive into the 400+ integrations that Datadog works with
• Ensure successful onboarding of new Solutions Engineers
• Help triage Solutions Engineering queues and work with Product and Engineering on urgent matters
• Review and help prioritize Solutions Engineering escalations
• Dispatch customer requests throughout the day as part of a queue rotation schedule
• Oversee demo training and assist in demo certification
• Assist with incident response during outages/incidents, communicating with customers and providing our internal teams with info that we’re getting first-hand from those customers
• Build out documentation and knowledge base articles for a variety of technologies

You Are:
• Passionate about people management and/or mentorship with previous experience leading a team
• Self-motivated, detail-attentive, and have a desire for continuous learning
• A critical thinker who defaults to a client-centric approach
• A tinkerer with some programming experience and a basic knowledge of Linux
• Able to work a rotating schedule that requires weekend availability

Bonus Points:
• CS or Engineering majors
• Active contribution to open-source projects (code, bug reports, etc.) and the Engineering Community (Meetups, etc.)

Why You Should Apply:
• Generous and competitive global and US benefits
• New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan
• Continuous career development and pathing opportunities
• Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and space
• Best in breed onboarding
• Internal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentally
• Friendly and inclusive workplace culture

About Datadog:

Datadog is the monitoring and security platform for cloud applications. Our SaaS product is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries to enable digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stack, allowing for seamless collaboration and problem-solving among Dev, Ops and Security teams globally. Given the resilience of cloud technologies and importance placed today in digital operations and agility, Datadog continues to innovate and is well positioned for the long term.

job_description:
This company’s products are a marketplace for on-demand work for the retail industry.

We are looking for a Director/Head of Product who is a great manager and team builder. She/he needs to be an excellent recruiter, communicator, and problem solver and able to deliver the product on time, while ensuring the team is hitting their mark. This is an intense role in a fast growing startup backed by top VCs. While the candidate doesn’t need to have started a company, the candidate must be incredibly entrepreneurial.

Candidate will:

Define the future of a gig economy platform for retail workers across Latin America

Drive efforts in building our different products across geographies

Lead a cross-functional team of passionate people to build out features and bring them live to the platform

Recruit and build a powerhouse product team that delivers outstanding results to our gig workers, internal users and retail/CPG customers.

Develop and model product culture across the company

Discover and define the right problems and products we should be pursuing

Balance and Prioritize new features with existing backlog initiatives and align them with product strategy

Be incredibly truth-seeking and collect all data necessary to inform product direction, whether in the form of competitive intel, customer behavior, or other business metrics

Communicate the needs and product concepts to stakeholders, engineers, designers, and other product team members

Manage an initial team of 4 Product Managers that drive our products including a consumer facing mobile app, internal dashboards and B2B web/mobile interface

Set goals, strategies, budgets, and oversee deployment of large-scale projects across multiple sites.

Evangelize product vision, strategy, and roadmap with internal and external stakeholders; be the face of Expanse in key customer interactions

Represent the product team in high-stakes customer, prospect and partner conversations

Zubale focuses on Crowdsourcing, Mobile Games, Brand Marketing, Mobile Application, and Brand Development. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees.

You can view their website at https://www.zubale.com/ or find them on Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn.

job_description:
Company Overview

DiDi Global Inc. is the world’s leading mobility technology platform. It offers a wide range of app-based services across markets including Asia-Pacific, Latin America and Africa, including ride hailing, taxi hailing, chauffeur, hitch and other forms of shared mobility as well as auto solutions, food delivery, intra-city freight, and financial services.

DiDi provides car owners, drivers, and delivery partners with flexible work and income opportunities. It is committed to collaborating with policymakers, the taxi industry, the automobile industry and the communities to solve the world’s transportation, environmental and employment challenges through the use of AI technology and localized smart transportation innovations. DiDi strives to create better life experiences and greater social value, by building a safe, inclusive and sustainable transportation and local services ecosystem for cities of the future.

For more information, please visit: www.didiglobal.com/news

Team Overview

We are looking for a data analysis manager for the Business Intelligence team for the Cash Loan LOB in Mexico. This team serves as the data mid-platform for the business, on which you will work closely with the Operation team, Product team, Risk team, Finance team, Data Engineering team, etc. You will be working on various types of data analytics projects in the areas of customer acquisition, customer management, product improvement, customer valuation, financial projection, etc

This role provides data-driven support to the Cash Loan LOB in Mexico.

Role Responsibilities
• Help build the robust and efficient data infrastructure based on the understanding to the business, determine the key metrics for analysis and the corresponding dimensions and produce automated dashboards and data analysis reports for tracking the business performance
• Figuring out the key problems in the development of the business based on data analysis and provide practical solutions and recommendations for optimizations
• Establishing and perform experiment and evaluation mechanism to evaluate the operations strategy and specific activities, and produce comprehensive analysis report

Role Qualifications
• Bachelor degree required, preferably in the areas related with statistics, mathematics, computer science or finance
• 5 years or more work experience on data analysis, preferably in the industries related with personal financial services, such as personal loans and credit card
• Strong at quantitative analysis skills. Be fluent at multiple data analysis tools and be able to independently perform data query, processing, analysis and visualization
• Detail-oriented and highly sensitive to the patterns and trends behind the data. Be good at logical and critical thinking and good at deriving analytical framework for real business problems
• Fluent at English. Be able to work efficiently in an English-speaking environment

EEO Statement
• We create customer value – We strive to always create valuable experiences for our users in everything we do. Our focus is to always innovate new experiences that are safe, pleasant, and efficient.
• We are data-driven – We are strong believers in making informed decisions, that’s why we are data-driven. We can better navigate the business landscape strategically by analyzing valuable metrics.
• We believe in Win-win Collaboration – Success is a team sport. When we work to help our partners and colleagues win, we win, too. While keeping everyone's best interest at heart, we communicate with candor and execute with excellence in all we do.
• We believe in integrity – Integrity is at the very core of our business. We are people who always want to do the right thing. Our intentions are sincere, we speak our minds and listen to each other.
• We always strive to do better. That means venturing beyond our comfort zones, learning from our mistakes, and helping each other grow.
• We believe in Diversity and Inclusion – Diversity is one of our biggest strengths. Our differences are what makes us distinct. We respect each other and believe in equal opportunities for all.

We are committed to building inclusive and diverse teams.

At DiDi, we believe that our differences are our biggest source of strength. That‘s why we are committed to promoting equal opportunities to all candidates and employees as an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Employment and advancement decisions at DiDi are always made based on the needs of the position and the qualifications of the candidate. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant based on their gender, age, sexual orientation, nationality, marital status, pregnancy/maternity, disability, race, religion and beliefs, or any other status protected by applicable laws wherever we operate.

We are committed to building inclusive and diverse teams, and a workplace that is free from discrimination and harassment, because that’s how we create better products and services, make better decisions and better serve the communities we’re a part of.

I acknowledge that prior to submitting this application, I have read and accepted the Privacy Notice for Candidates which is available on https://careers.didiglobal.com/terms

job_description:
Job Description

Primary Function of Position:
• Develop, lead and execute purchasing strategies for all tactical procurement (direct and indirect).
• Responsible of all purchasing process related with direct and indirect components, materials and services to support manufacturing operations.
• Responsible to align capabilities and leading tactical buyers in multiple locations and countries.
• Ensure the optimal inventory levels through the application of lean manufacturing initiatives.
• With the purchasing team’s support ensure the correct supply of components, materials and number of parts to maintain material health targets.
• Drive internal adoption to established procurement policy and process, strategic sourcing, supplier selection (Specifically for indirect) - proposal analysis, SOW clarification, contract negotiations (Indirect), supplier database management and purchase order creation.
• Support Strategic Purchasing in developing sourcing strategies to achieve aggressive cost reduction targets while driving for a high quality and highly flexible and responsive supply-base.
• Assist in driving key procurement initiatives to support the ongoing transformation and continuous improvement of systems and processes in the procurement organization along with other projects as directed by management.
• Ensures compliance with regulations such as SOX, Incoterms, and corporate internal controls.
• Supports new processes, special programs and new production lines in indirect purchasing assuring adequate delivery, quality and cost of equipment and tools needs for projects.

Roles & Responsibilities:

Management of buyers
• Creates, trains and supports purchasing buyers on standard work, in order to maintain consistency in quality and quantity of work output.
• Purchase order approval
• Alerts Strategic Purchasing when supplier capacity outputs need to be raised to support operations.
• Select talent, train, and develop skills of purchasing department.
• Lead buyers to meet target metrics.
• Management of overall team performance including annual appraisals
• Phase in and phase out of Engineering Change Orders (ECOs) for all buyers.
• Effectively manages task breakdown, helps keep individual contributors on task, player-coach; ability to step in and perform hard tasks.

Supplier Management
• Ensure suppliers meet key performance objectives.
• Lead development of supplier strategies to meet Company performance and growth.
• Support supply risk assessment
• If required participate in supplier audits, and capability assessments.
• Provide data for forecast and performance reviews with key suppliers to support supply planning and buffer demand volatility.

Production Support
• Track line down occurrences due to material shortages and perform root cause analysis.
• Implement corrective actions to remove supply chain risk.
• Ensure expeditious delivery of all critical materials.
• Drive improvement initiatives with production management as applicable

Cost and Contracting
• Support annual cost reductions to achieve corporate initiative plan.
• Lead implementation of business and quality agreements with key indirect suppliers to secure expectations for delivery, quality, cost and other obligations of the business relationship
• Supports standard cost setting activities.

Inventory Management
• Implement inventory management techniques (Kanban) to increase raw material inventory turns performance.
• Manage excess and obsolescence review process.

Systems
• Increase productivity of buyers by reducing/eliminating administrative tasks required by ERP system.
• Schedule agreement / control cycle
• Automating purchase orders placement
• Online quoting
• Paperless record management
• Drawings
• Regulatory OEM complaints
• Improve system reports, create new tableau reports/tools/automation improvements.

Tools maintenance
• Drive our Culture Strategy by fostering our mission, founding principles, individual and leadership expectations.

job_description:
Company Overview

DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they agree. Our flagship product, eSignature, is the world’s #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from virtually anywhere, at any time. Today, more than a million customers and a billion users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people’s lives.

What you'll do

The DocuSign Customer Account Manager (CAM) is responsible for a portfolio of accounts and renewals in an assigned territory. The CAM serves as a customer adoption advisor, driving a return on our customers’ investment in DocuSign and unlocking further digitalization. Within their defined territory, the CAM is responsible for developing and implementing effective customer success and value strategies, identifying growth opportunities, negotiating favorable renewal terms, and providing insights to the business and customers that improve future outcomes. This role will be a valuable member of the Account team, working in collaboration with our Sales Team (Account Executives). The ideal candidate will drive accountability with themselves and their business partners, thriving in a fast-paced environment.

This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Director, Customer Success Account Management.

Responsibility
• Prevent risk and drive growth in our customers through early engagement, driving value, engaging with key partners as measured by renewal outcomes
• Achieve financial and strategic revenue, bookings and billings targets
• Maintain and update accurately a rolling forecast of your territory and communicate any renewal risk to internal resources in order to develop resolution strategies
• Own and implement win/win negotiation strategies for DocuSign’s strategic renewals while protecting and improving customer trust
• Conduct regular business reviews with our customers to ensure that they are embraced and deriving value from our product, and we are aligned with their primary objectives
• Be accountable for the full adoption strategy, using key partners across the DocuSign ecosystem to deliver comprehensive paths for success
• Serve as the primary point of contact and facilitation on behalf of our customers for any escalation concerns
• Collaborate with internal resources such as, but not limited to, Sales, Customer Success, Pricing, Legal, Revenue Operations and Product Management to develop growth and risk mitigation strategies for key accounts
• Improve account growth by taking a major role within the account team, helping to identify incremental growth opportunities within the account, and involving the appropriate internal resources where applicable
• Evaluate your portfolio and optimally analyze usage, health, data, and behavioral patterns to prioritize time to render the most favorable outcomes for the customer and DocuSign.
• Follow best practices for all internal processes including, opportunity management, data quality and accuracy, CRM hygiene, quotes and forecasting
• Be an owner of the renewal process, ensuring that key timelines are met and the renewal is mutually beneficial

Job Designation

Hybrid: Employee divides their time between in-office and remote work. Access to an office location is required. (Frequency: Minimum 2 days per week; may vary by team but will be weekly in-office expectation)

Positions at DocuSign are assigned a job designation of either In Office, Hybrid or Remote and are specific to the role/job. Preferred job designations are not guaranteed when changing positions within DocuSign. DocuSign reserves the right to change a position's job designation depending on business needs and as permitted by local law.

What you bring

Basic
• 5+ years of experience within Sales, Renewal Management, Account Management and/or Customer Success - ideally within SaaS offerings
• Experience with quota-carrying roles and proven history of meeting key performance indicators
• Experience with deal negotiation cycles with a successful track record
• BA/BS degree or equivalent work experience

Preferred
• Strong contract negotiation skills with experience driving contracts to completion on-time
• Experience with supporting adoption across organizations, serving as a change agent for the customer
• Ability to demonstrate a strategic approach to enable persuasive value conversations with customers at an executive level
• Ability to react and adapt to potential rapid shifts in priorities
• Strong level of urgency, organization and prioritization skills
• Salesforce experience
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Ability to convey value through interactions with customers

Life at DocuSign

Working here

DocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agreeable for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal.

We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better than we found it. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live.

Accommodation

DocuSign provides reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in job application procedures. If you need such an accommodation, including if you need accommodation to properly utilize our online system, you may contact us at accommodations@docusign.com.

If you experience any technical difficulties or issues during the application process, or with our interview tools, please reach out to us at taops@docusign.com for assistance.

Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice
