job_description:
Position Overview:Join us as a Marketing Producer in Mexico City!

You'll bring to life title marketing campaigns, creating unforgettable public experiences. Your diverse production experience and deep understanding of the Mexican market will be invaluable in our fast-paced, dynamic environment, just like every production environment in a high-performance company.

Who you are:A Marketing Production Manager is a resilient team player who thrives on change, is detail-oriented, and has a global business vision. You're comfortable working with all levels of the organization and understand the value of nurturing relationships with agencies and vendors. You're adaptable and ready to adjust workflows as necessary. You're passionate about executing ideas with a clear north star for success and always pursue operational excellence.

Key responsibilities:

Excellent Project Management skills
• Driving top-notch execution as an operational expert, bringing innovative campaign ideas to life.
• Acting as the guardian of excellence in execution, demonstrating craftsmanship and attention to detail.
• Ensuring that vendors involved in a project and stakeholders consistently meet their deadlines.
• Proactively troubleshooting, anticipating, and creatively solving problems in a timely manner during a production setup.
• Having a holistic point of view when working cross-functionally on each initiative from both creative and production perspectives.
• Jumping into conversations when needed to clarify project concerns with the team, vendors, or agencies.
• Sharing toolkits and available material with agencies as required.
• Collaborating effectively with various teams, ensuring deadlines are consistently met.

Local production expertise:
• Coordinating and overseeing a variety of production types like AV, experiential, digital, and traditional, among others.
• Developing bespoke production strategies for each campaign and offering tailored production solutions.
• Evaluating the technical feasibility according to the creative idea and identifying the best vendors for the projects.
• Selecting vendors, overseeing production paperwork, and managing budgets to ensure successful, feasible campaigns.
• Making sure that everything is produced in line with the vision and Netflix's creative and operational quality standards.

Solution-oriented and curious by nature:
• Thrive on change and use it to fuel creative solutions, maintaining the capacity to elevate production values and local impact even when facing unexpected challenges.
• Consistently look for ways to improve how we bring ideas to life, considering new tools, technologies, and trends.
• Maintain an open mindset, prioritizing ideas and finding ways to make things work, avoiding the mindset of "can't be done".
• Emphasize simplicity and efficiency in decision-making, always optimizing available resources.

Cross-Functional Collaboration:
• Collaborate with other marketing producers, support agency onboarding, and advise on best practices.
• Cultivate strong relationships with top-tier agencies and vendors.

Requirements:
• 7+ years of diverse production experience, particularly in the creative industry (preferred in advertising/events).
• Proven experience in corporate environments, agencies, and/or brands.
• Budget management and a knack for bringing ideas to life.
• Comfortably handle at least two campaigns per month and six different types of campaigns per year.
• High tolerance for change and resilience in demanding, fast-paced environments.
• Passion for Entertainment, Design, local and worldwide pop culture, Technology, Arts, and Advertising.
• Impeccable record of cultivating diverse relationships with vendors, partners, agencies, and production companies.
• Committed to creating more inclusive and safe workspaces.
• Fluent in English.
• Familiar with digital experiences, virtual reality, or the metaverse (preferred not limited).

Netflix focuses on Digital Entertainment. Their company has offices in Los Gatos. They have a very large team that's 5000+ employees. To date, Netflix has raised $3.102B of funding; their latest round was closed on April 2018.

You can view their website at https://www.netflix.com/in/ or find them on LinkedIn.

job_description:
Available Locations: Mexico

About the Department:

The Partner team works hard to grow the Partner ecosystem around Cloudflare. Channel Account Managers, Partner Development teams, and Partner Solutions Engineers all support partner businesses as they grow and scale with Cloudflare. All working together help our customers adopt Cloudflare and create great Internet-enabled experiences.

About the Role:

This role is strategically focused on service delivery and operational excellence for Cloudflare’s Managed Service Providers (MSPs) and Distribution Partners. In this player/coach role, you will guide Channel partners through their Cloudflare journey with your strong leadership, technical, and business acumen as well as lead, mentor, and develop a team to deliver technical services coverage to MSP and Distribution partners. This role/team helps our partners build and scale different service offerings to ensure our end-customers receive an amazing Cloudflare experience.

You’ll be pivotal in streamlining and ongoing satisfaction with Cloudflare services provided by channel partners. Your position involves high-level engagements and discussions with C-suite executives at partner organizations, focusing on post sales partner success. You'll be responsible for ensuring the smooth onboarding of new partners, providing ongoing post-sales support, and maintaining high partner satisfaction. Your technical knowledge of Cloudflare’s solution, industry expertise, familiarity with go to market models and ability to manage large cross-functional projects will allow you to act as a trusted advisor for your partners alongside Cloudflare’s Partner Success Managers, Channel & Alliance Managers and Solutions Engineers.

To aid your team, you will work closely with every team at Cloudflare, from Sales and Product, through to Engineering and Customer Support. Your goal of partner and customer success should drive you through the entire organization as you seek out and advise your team on how to provide scalable technical services coverage for partner needs.

Reporting to the Head of Partner Services, you will own the performance and development of the team with accountability for Team Development, Operational Diligence, and partner with the Revenue organization to drive positive outcomes in developing technical partner practices.

Specifically, we are looking for you to:
• Actively engage with MSPs and distribution partners, guiding them through their journey with Cloudflare, focusing on post-sales and onboarding processes.
• Develop and manage a tailored support framework for MSPs and distributor partners, ensuring they receive the assistance needed for efficient Cloudflare solution deployment and management.
• Oversee the creation of specialized resources and tools designed to enhance partner capabilities in service delivery and customer support.
• Utilize your strong communication skills and technical understanding to develop strong relationships with partners.
• Lead your team with clarity and empathy, creating a culture of innovation, safety, and creativity.
• Clearly articulate and implement your team’s vision and strategy, promoting collaboration and operational excellence.
• Oversee and report on various initiatives and projects, focusing on enhancing partner capabilities and development within the post-sales landscape.
• Concentrate on mentoring and developing your team, ensuring they possess both the functional and technical skills necessary for effective partner support.
• Champion the development of technical services practices for partners, collaborating with colleagues to create enriching partner experiences.
• Establish a continuous feedback loop with partners to identify areas for improvement in post-sales support, leading initiatives to enhance partner satisfaction and success.
• Ability to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to Cloudflare services.
• Strong grasp of networking concepts, including DNS, CDN, and web security.
• Understanding of cybersecurity principles and practices.
• Experience with API management and integration, essential for automating and customizing service platforms.
• Experience with cloud-native solutions, architectures, and services, especially those relevant to scalable and secure internet operations.

We know that the ideal candidate may not have all of the above skills on Day 1 and we’re committed to developing and investing in the right person for the role.

job_description:
At Trane TechnologiesTM and through our businesses including Trane® and Thermo King®, we create innovative climate solutions for buildings, homes, and transportation that challenge what’s possible for a sustainable world. We're a team that dares to look at the world's challenges and see impactful possibilities. We believe in a better future when we uplift others and enable our people to thrive at work and at home. We boldly go.

Job Summary：

Trane Technologies is hiring a Category Manager directly managing the Metal Fabrication category. This is a critical role on our Procurement team, with a large, complex scope of responsibilities within the assigned category. We are looking for a Subject Matter Expert (SME) to own the space, strategy, supply base, and performance, and stay current on market trends and conditions in this category.

This position is eligible for a Hybrid work schedule, and will be based out of our Monterrey, MX location.

Responsibilities:
• Manage the Metal Fabrication category
• Identify, engage and align with internal stakeholders to capture category requirements and ensure supplier qualification and quality;
• Partner with business unit Procurement teams to efficiently transition suppliers as needed; Support region/sector New Product Development (NPD) Procurement teams through preferred supplier programs.
• Responsible for developing and executing detailed category strategy, expanding the Preferred Supplier Program and segmentation based on the business needs and effective procurement principles.
• Assess opportunity for commodity including spend segmentation, commodity maturity, cost drivers, and supply market analysis
• Negotiations: Manage contract lifecycle and compliance, ensure supply continuity and deliver best total value through RFx activities in order to execute supplier selection and negotiation.
• Risk Management: Actively monitor and mitigate supplier risk including financial, capacity, quality and compliance.
• Cost Management: Responsible for delivering category productivity through price, value analysis (VA) or continuous improvement projects.
• Supplier Management: Oversee Supplier Relationship Management (SRM) and regular supplier reviews for all strategic suppliers within category to meet program Quality/Cost/Delivery targets.
• Scribe for all quarterly reviews and key supplier meetings, while ensuring creation of supplier profiles for all SRM suppliers
• Develop sourcing strategy for commodity detailing projects, sourcing levers, timing, resources, and expected benefits
• Responsible for commodity continuity of supply - engage with plants to efficiently resolve escalated issues and formally manage and secure supplier capacity.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s Degree
• 5+ years of procurement / sourcing experience with large-scale, complex, and/or regional/global categories of spend.
• Demonstrated success in assessing, negotiating and managing vendors.
• Collaborative, facilitation, consultation and conflict resolution skills; you will be a trusted business partner and engage both internal and external stakeholders/customers, and we are seeking the ability to collaborate and influence within a highly matrixed environment.
• Professional communication; both verbal and written are required.
• Ability to travel as needed.

We offer competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits and programs. We are an equal opportunity employer; all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, pregnancy, age, marital status, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any legally protected status.

job_description:
Company Overview

DiDi Global Inc. is the world’s leading mobility technology platform. It offers a wide range of app-based services across markets including Asia-Pacific, Latin America and Africa, including ride hailing, taxi hailing, chauffeur, hitch and other forms of shared mobility as well as auto solutions, food delivery, intra-city freight, and financial services.

DiDi provides car owners, drivers, and delivery partners with flexible work and income opportunities. It is committed to collaborating with policymakers, the taxi industry, the automobile industry and the communities to solve the world’s transportation, environmental and employment challenges through the use of AI technology and localized smart transportation innovations. DiDi strives to create better life experiences and greater social value, by building a safe, inclusive and sustainable transportation and local services ecosystem for cities of the future.

For more information, please visit: www.didiglobal.com/news

Team Overview

In the CX area, we are hundreds of people, from different places and with different cultures, responsible for strategically managing the customers' experience throughout their journey with the company.

We are a customer-centric team, which means that we adopt and apply a list of key experience principles that establish the expected behaviors, mindset, processes, metrics and ways of working to protect customer’s experience while generating value to the business. We look for people who are willing to embrace these principles by going far and beyond to bring them to life, and more importantly, who are passionate and driven by positively impact people’s lives and experiences.

DiDi is a key to deliver a great journey to all customers. Our team is dynamic, multicultural, diverse and full of passionate people located in Latin America whose mission is to deliver a WOW service to our clients.

The CX Ops Manager is responsible of defininng the CX strategy for the Paymens business line, ensuring the achievement of strategic goals and optimizing resource allocation.

In this position, the CX Ops Manager will be in charge of mapping current and future processes, implement deep dive analysis to uncover areas of improvement and design the service delivery strategy to ensure a great experience to our users, while creating internal efficiencies to maximize value generation to the business.

Additionally, this possition will be supporting the definition and execution of strategic initiatives to build the best-in-class experience in coordination with teams in China and LATAM.

Role Responsibilities
• Design and implement process/product improvements.
• Deep dive analysis to generate actionable insights to provide a seamless user experience.
• Define the governance with internal/external stakeholders and efficiently coordinate cross-team cooperation.
• Optimize resource allocation to implement strategic initiatives.
• Capable of coordinating projects independently to achieve the OKRs.
• Support on the launch of new products and regions.

Role Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree in engineering, business administration or similar.
• Min 5 years of relevant work experience in consulting, operations, customer experience or related area (preferred background in financial services).
• Experience mananging multiple stakeholders.
• Proficiency in Excel and Google Suites required.
• Proficiency in English required.
• Comfort working with teams in different time zones .
• Knowledge in SQL (nice to have).
• Must be able to work with minimal supervision, be self-starter and prioritize own work to meet deadlines with a hands-on mentality.

EEO Statement
• We create customer value – We strive to always create valuable experiences for our users in everything we do. Our focus is to always innovate new experiences that are safe, pleasant, and efficient.
• We are data-driven – We are strong believers in making informed decisions, that’s why we are data-driven. We can better navigate the business landscape strategically by analyzing valuable metrics.
• We believe in Win-win Collaboration – Success is a team sport. When we work to help our partners and colleagues win, we win, too. While keeping everyone's best interest at heart, we communicate with candor and execute with excellence in all we do.
• We believe in integrity – Integrity is at the very core of our business. We are people who always want to do the right thing. Our intentions are sincere, we speak our minds and listen to each other.
• We always strive to do better. That means venturing beyond our comfort zones, learning from our mistakes, and helping each other grow.
• We believe in Diversity and Inclusion – Diversity is one of our biggest strengths. Our differences are what makes us distinct. We respect each other and believe in equal opportunities for all.

We are committed to building inclusive and diverse teams.

At DiDi, we believe that our differences are our biggest source of strength. That‘s why we are committed to promoting equal opportunities to all candidates and employees as an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Employment and advancement decisions at DiDi are always made based on the needs of the position and the qualifications of the candidate. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant based on their gender, age, sexual orientation, nationality, marital status, pregnancy/maternity, disability, race, religion and beliefs, or any other status protected by applicable laws wherever we operate.

We are committed to building inclusive and diverse teams, and a workplace that is free from discrimination and harassment, because that’s how we create better products and services, make better decisions and better serve the communities we’re a part of.

I acknowledge that prior to submitting this application, I have read and accepted the Privacy Notice for Candidates which is available on https://careers.didiglobal.com/terms

job_description:
Your Tasks

Role Purpose:

We’re looking for passionate and self-directed individual that is passionate for data and fact-based rationale to lead the development of CMI team, this includes but not limited to inhouse analytics, BI visualizations and market conduct research studies to contribute with insightful proposals to marketing team strategy and tackle core business needs.

Main Accountabilities:
• Synthesize and connect multiple sources of data into coherent and actionable output, with analytics, data visualization, dashboard reporting.
• Create accessible tools to improve the decision making for multifunctional teams - from pulling data & insights to standardize and simplify the information and create different visualizations like dashboards to make recommendations.
• Serve as a data expert and be able to effectively translate any insights into strategy
• Promote data-informed decision making in the marketing team
• Maintaining and owning existing data pipelines/dashboards; ensuring accuracy and data quality
• Manage budget, partnership and relationships with the data suppliers and market research vendors
• Collaborate with regional insights function on key regional/global initiatives, and market research planning whenever needed
• Contribute to the development and execution of the organization's data and analytics strategy to maximize impact on revenue growth and profitability
• Utilize a statistical approach to analyze and standardize business needs and lead the design and implementation of inhouse analytics and governance solutions.
• Use Power BI or another professional statistics toolset to aggregate relevant marketing and sales performance data and compile statistical analyses of business performance.
• Help the commercial operations team ensure we are focusing on the high value opportunities that drive profitable growth while ensuring the positive share. Diagnose and track the category/market combos that allow us to gain share across categories and territories
• Use fact-based, strategic approach to identify the insights, strategies, and leading-edge solutions to boost local/granular strategy, with actionable levers.
• Make suggestions to the Brand team to optimize their plans instore using the ‘instore drive plan’ to steer when media should be executed

Your Profile

Knowledge, Skills and Experience:

Education
• Bachelor’s or higher degree in Mathematics, Statistics
• Advanced English
• Masters in BI or Data analytics is a plus

Experience
• 5+ years of experience as a Market Analyst, Researcher, Data Analyst or a similar role
• Evidence and fact base-minded and results-focused with experience in working with retail sales data or similar
• Experience in using sales data base, RMS tools (such as Nielsen, Kantar).
• Strong ability to interpret results connecting the dots and provide insights
• Bringing in outside in perspective and has eyes on the ground to come and give feedback to ops and strategy team on market activities, macro-economic trends, and competitive intelligence.
• Understanding of different analytics trends like predictive models and AI/ML is a plus

Skills
• Comfortable working alone but not in silos. Part of a team but capable of working with blank spaces
• Ability to take, absorb and action feedback from multiple partners and leaders across the business
• Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to effectively collaborate with all management levels
• Excellent project management and organizational skills
• Motivated, proactive, self-starter with a positive can-do attitude and ability to easily adapt to changing priorities and directions
• Developed project management skills; track record of overseeing a portfolio of transformation projects.
• Excellent analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
• Passion for data, attention for details and its potential to drive business impact

job_description:
Job Description

Danfoss Mexico is looking for an experienced Cost Out Manager for our Plant in Reynosa, Mexico. This role will be responsible for managing Cost Out Projectg activities to improve the overall cost positition of FACTS BU process and products. The role will do this through participation in design for manufacturability reviews for new product development, manage key value stream projects to drive more efficient value streams, work with engineering to introduce new materials and design changes to drive more effective materials and process for our existing product in production.

Job Responsibilities
• Manage project activities to assure continue follow up to detailed project plan to know who must do what by when.
• Follow up with stakeholders constantly/persistently on getting the actions completed (including stakeholders outside the plant).
• Lead Cost Out sessions to have a strong project funnel for FACTS BU and assure correct tracking of savings with Fianance approval.
• Run design for manufacturability reviews on new product developments and existing serial production product to make sure design is optimized for production
• Identify need for investments and give input to stakeholders
• Track Capital Budget for BU and ensure on-time execution to plan and timely spending of Capital budget focused on Cost Out Projects.
• Ensure Investments are driving the Key Indicatiors improvements tied to the business case developed.
• Identify Opportunities to improve/eliminate materials and processes to improve our overall quality and cost position on the market.
• Handling deviation and secure quality protocols and specifications
• Secure safety, Support and secure that the production foundation are according to all safety and enviromental standards
• Build a strong culture in FACTS Connectors around Value Added / Value Engineering to make sure that design is thinking about cost and environmental impacts of their design and first stages of design roll-out.
• Support and build network across the business unit.

Background & Skills

At Danfoss, we believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace fosters creativity, innovation, and a broader perspective in decision-making. When you consider this job posting, do you feel like your profile is not a perfect match? Numerous studies have found that women and people of color are more likely to apply only when they meet all requirements listed in the job posting. Even if you do not check all the boxes, we encourage you to apply anyway. We are curious to find out how you can bring new insights to the role or to Danfoss as an organization.

The ideal candidate possesses these skills.
• Bachelor degree (Manufacturing Technology engineer Prefered)
• 3 to 5 years of experience
• Possesses Effective Communication Skills
• Demonstrates a Collaborative Style
• Drives for Results
• Makes Decisions/Solves Problems
• Promotes and Champions Change
• Pursues Personal Development
• Possesses Interpersonal Savvy (Supplier/Customer Relationships) "
• Bilingual English / Spanish
• Design for Manufacturing Roll-Out/Experience
• Project Managment Skills (PMP certified preferred)
• Technical procurement person or has OPEX experience
• Prefered experience in plastic extrusion and processing

Employee Benefits

We are excited to offer you the following benefits with your employment:
• Competitive Salary
• Christmas Bonus
• Food Vouchers
• Saving Fund
• Major Medical Insurance
• Career Development

This list does not promise or guarantee any particular benefit or specific action. They may depend on country or contract specifics and are subject to change at any time without prior notice.

Danfoss – Engineering Tomorrow

At Danfoss, we are engineering solutions that allow the world to use resources in smarter ways - driving the sustainable transformation of tomorrow. No transformation has ever been started without a group of passionate, dedicated and empowered people. We believe that innovation and great results are driven by the right mix of people with diverse backgrounds, personalities, skills, and perspectives, reflecting the world in which we do business. To make sure the mix of people works, we strive to create an inclusive work environment where people of all backgrounds are treated equally, respected, and valued for who they are. It is a strong priority within Danfoss to improve the health, working environment and safety of our employees.

Following our founder’s mindset “action speaks louder than words”, we set ourselves ambitious targets to protect the environment by embarking on a plan to become CO2 neutral latest by 2030.

Danfoss is an EO employer and VEVRAA Federal Contractor. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or other protected category.

job_description:
All roles at JumpCloud are Remote unless otherwise specified in the Job Description.

About JumpCloud

JumpCloud® helps IT teams and Managed Service Providers (MSPs) Make Work Happen® by centralizing management of user identities and devices, enabling small and medium-sized enterprises to adopt Zero Trust security models. JumpCloud has been used by more than 200,000 organizations, including GoFundMe, Grab, ClassPass, Beyond Finance, and Foursquare. JumpCloud has raised over $400M from world-class investors including Sapphire Ventures, General Atlantic, Sands Capital, Atlassian, and CrowdStrike. Our teams are growing fast, too, and we're looking for talent across engineering, sales, customer success, marketing, product management, and more. Join our team of dedicated, passionate, and creative people who are eager to change the IT industry forever.

About the Team:

This role is responsible for JumpCloud’s Global Compensation Programs; all elements including base salary, STI/LTI, and equity. This role will lead, in partnership with the Director of Total Rewards and Operations, a full assessment and up-leveling of the current JumpCloud compensation structure. This role will also be a key partner for the People Business Partners (PBP) in assessing compensation needs and building solutions.

What you’ll be doing:
• Manages the annual benchmarking review and analyzes data from survey sources to determine competitiveness both internally and externally.
• Leads with data and comprehensive analytics to recommend best practices in the development, implementation and administration of compensation programs.
• Designs and prepares ad hoc compensation analysis for the People Team and for the business
• Lead the annual merit increase process Globally
• Manages the development of salary structures and market pricing recommendations.
• Evaluates each new role in the organization for pricing throughout the year.
• Enhances knowledge of market through participating in wage surveys and spot-surveys
• Analyzes data and presents in easily digestible form for the People Team and the business. Comes prepared with key observations from the data.
• Manages compensation data in HRIS software and comp planning modules. Monitor for discrepancies and updates needed to keep this one-source of truth accurate.
• Manages the administration and communication of the compensation strategy and philosophy to all stakeholders within the organization.

We’re looking for:
• An expert in partnering with the business to evaluate and present solutions for compensation needs
• A critical thinker who can digest large data sets and present them in a clear and concise manner with meaningful observations.
• A strategic, best practices expert in compensation - someone who has seen a fully baked compensation structure and can make recommendations to the design and structure at JC.

Preferred Qualifications:
• 10+ years of experience in GLOBAL compensation; ideally at an emerging tech company.
• Experience working in and submitting company data within the Radford Salary Survey Platform

#LI-MH1

Where you’ll be working/Location:

JumpCloud is committed to being Remote First, meaning that you are able to work remotely within the country noted in the Job Description.

This role is remote in the country of Mexico. You must be located in and authorized to work in Mexico to be considered for this role.

Why JumpCloud?

If you thrive working in a fast, SaaS-based environment and you are passionate about solving challenging technical problems, we look forward to hearing from you! JumpCloud is an incredible place to share and grow your expertise! You’ll work with amazing talent across each department who are passionate about our mission. We’re out of the box thinkers, so your unique ideas and approaches for conceiving a product and/or feature will be welcome. You’ll have a voice in the organization as you work with a seasoned executive team, a supportive board and in a proven market that our customers are excited about.

One of JumpCloud's three core values is to “Build Connections.” To us that means creating ' human connection with each other regardless of our backgrounds, orientations, geographies, religions, languages, gender, race, etc. We care deeply about the people that we work with and want to see everyone succeed.' - Rajat Bhargava, CEO

Please submit your résumé and brief explanation about yourself and why you would be a good fit for JumpCloud. Please note JumpCloud is not accepting third party resumes at this time.

JumpCloud is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

job_description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.

Description

Amazon aims to be earth's most customer-centric company. In order to do that, we aim to provide our customers the widest selection of products at great prices. The Marketplace business contributes to a significant portion of the total Amazon sales. For our growing Marketplace business we are seeking a dynamic Sr. Product Manager for Selection in Latam marketplaces (Brazil and Mexico).

This role requires a strategic thinker who has exceptional skills, can root-cause tough business problems, and can define innovative ways to use technology to tackle them at scale. As a leader of this role you will have high leadership visibility and will manage multiple stakeholders across the globe. Also, this position will own, develop and deliver on a roadmap to increase our selection by offering the widest selection in LatAm with the best experience to customers. The position will drive Selection for 3P business, while also will work closer to Retail team to set the strategy for Amazon Stores. This is an individual contributor position, and will lead the topic functionally across teams.

Key job responsibilities
• Selection strategy and operationalization: Analyzing local and international categories to identify selection gaps and leading selection strategy for 3P and initiatives in collaboration with sales teams for Brazil and Mexico.
• Business development: Developing and executing an innovative selection roadmap. Measuring performance and identifying key success drivers; translating business insights into clear requirements.
• Functional Leader: Lead the 3P selection, being the functional leader of the topic with the support of two Selection PMs focused on building new solutions.
• Analysis, optimization, and improvement: Measuring the impact of actions taken and refining plans to optimize performance.
• Managing and influencing multiple international stakeholders, including business, product, marketing, operations, legal, and leadership team. Build long term vision and operational plan for driving selection growth.

You are independent and flexible. You communicate excellently with cross-functional teams and inspire trust when presenting to senior leadership. You're customer obsessed, and have demonstrated business judgment and an ability to think strategically in a quick-paced, ambiguous setting. You simultaneously dive deep into the tactical details and set a broad strategic vision for execution and scale. You are quality obsessed and at distinguishing signal from noise and you generate insight from a variety of sources.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Mexico City, DIF, MEX

Basic Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent
• 5+ years of product or program management, product marketing, business development or technology experience
• Experience owning/driving roadmap strategy and definition
• Experience owning technology products
• Experience in using statistical analysis to identify issues or opportunities for improvement
• Experience in influencing senior leadership through data driven insights

Preferred Qualifications
• Experience working across functional teams and senior stakeholders
• Experience in areas such as market research, statistics, finance or qualitative/quantitative research
• Strong organizational skills with ability to balance competing priorities

job_description:
Auto req ID: 159395BR
Job Description

¿Do you want to be part of one of the most important foods and beverages companies of the world?

PepsiCo is a global leader in foods and beverages with a portfolio of 22 brands that generate more million dollars per year. Today we are looking for our next:

Global Procurement Sr. Manager

Principal propose –
Manage the procurement and commodity risk of all grains for Savory, Cookies & Crackers, and Nutrition across Mexico.
Corn, Cornmeal, Popcorn, Corn flour, Oats, Wheat flour, and other miscellaneous grains are critical raw materials for our foods businesses, extremely volatile in price and central to our Health and Wellness and Sustainability strategies. It is a key category for PMF, representing ~$239 MM in spend and requires excellent strategic planning, risk management and coordination with cross functional business teams.

Main responsabilities–
• Develop and execute the Category Sourcing Strategy and commodity risk management for grains ($239 MM annual spend). Leverage global grains strategy to lead the business across Mexico to optimum sourcing solutions using best in class contracting techniques.
• Develop accurate annual plans (AOP) and periodic forecasts for PMF and deliver against the AOP
• Lead cross-category teams to develop and deliver productivity and cash-flow improvement projects
• Lead the commercial aspects of new technologies such as seed development, variety selection, and milling, including collaboration with markets outside Mexico.
• Manage the price risk and coverage position in accordance with company policy and approved CRMC guidelines
• Maintain up-to-date market intelligence to inform the businesses of risks and opportunities vs forecast and guidance
• Manage all aspects of the commercial relationships with suppliers, including service and quality aspects
• Ongoing negotiation of supply agreements, contracts and pricing with suppliers through written contracts and/or purchase orders as applicable.
• Ensure safe, legal and sustainable supply in line with PepsiCo’s R&D, Vendor Assurance, Food Safety, Land Use, and Human Rights policies and all applicable procedures

Experience and profile -
• Education: Minimum of BA/BS Degree level or equivalent in a numerate discipline
• Experience: Minimum 5 years’ experience in purchasing. Experienced purchasing professional with prior experience in leading categories.
Skills:
• Drive for Results - Communicates persuasively to win support, minimizes or removes barriers that get in the way of achieving results, and leverages understanding of key business drivers in own area to get results
• Builds talent – experience managing and developing teams
• Collaborating & Influencing - influences others through reasoning and relationships and understands how to operate in a matrix organization and use networks appropriately to get things done.
Key GP Capabilities required to be successful: Category Knowledge & Strategy Development, Commodity Playbook Development and Risk Management, Supplier Negotiations, and Total Cost of Ownership

In PepsiCo, we are committed to offer equal development opportunities to all the candidates, no matter the religion, race, sexual orientation, nationality, age, etc. We respect and appreciate the diversity as a workforce and innovation to the organization.

If you have the profile that we are looking, send us your CV by this via, if it's possible that you can participate in this process we will contact you ASAP, if not we will keep your info in our base data for 6 months.

¡Thank you so much for your interest in PepsiCo!
Qualifications/Requirements
• Relocation Eligible: No Aplicable (N/A)
Job Type: Indefinido

job_description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, GFI Software. Have you got what it takes?

Are you a channel sales manager in the enterprise software industry seeking a transformative opportunity? If fostering relationships and directly contributing to the growth of your channel partners excite you, then GFI Software has an exceptional proposition for you. At IgniteTech and GFI Software, we're opening doors to an exceptional tech career, welcoming those who've honed their AI skills to elevate their expertise in a dynamic, aggressive environment. We're offering a rare chance where your primary focus will be to further expand your proficiency in LLMs, GenAI and how to use that to drive a tech company forward.

We're charting a new course in enterprise software sales, emphasizing collaboration and partnership over traditional direct selling. We understand the challenges of conventional sales roles - the stressful juggling of direct and indirect sales targets, the unpredictable compensation cycles, and the exhausting travel demands. We have reshaped these factors into a more appealing, effective, and rewarding structure.

In this role, you will use your account management prowess to drive channel sales across a broad portfolio of security, collaboration, and network management applications targeting small and medium enterprises. You'll create detailed sales forecasts, devise robust partner strategy plans, and influence strategic deals while co-selling with partners.

Another exciting factor here is the diversity of our partners; spanning from telecommunications to digital asset management. Each of these industries requires a unique software solution, adding a stimulating level of complexity to your role. You'll be a critical component in ensuring the relationship and customer base continues to expand within these varied landscapes.

If you're a quick learner and a highly organized individual possessing exemplary communication skills, apply now and step into a collaborative, fast-paced environment where every win is celebrated as a team!

What you will be doing
• Driving business growth by empowering and collaborating with a diverse network of channel partners
• Gaining a deep understanding of our products to inform and educate channel partners
• Regularly reviewing performance and strategy with your partners to help them reach their revenue targets

What you won’t be doing
• Directly selling to end-user customers
• Prioritizing the quantity of interactions over the quality of your engagements with partners
• Worrying about unpredictable earnings and relentless travel demands

AI-First Channel Account Manager key responsibilities
• Being a key contributor in developing and expanding channel sales in a large region and making sure GFI is the go-to solution for small and medium enterprises

Basic Requirements
• Previous experience working with GenAI tools (e.g., ChatGPT, Claude, Bard)
• 3+ years of indirect/channel sales experience for enterprise software products (if your only sales experience is direct sales, then you will be rejected for this role later in the application process)
• Experience leading a territory/region in channel sales
• Availability to work a schedule that has at least 90% overlap with standard working hours in North America (between GMT-5:00 and GMT-8:00)
• A grasp of AI, Large Language Models (LLMs), and prompt engineering, including Chain-of-Thought (CoT) prompting and Self-Consistency in CoT

About GFI Software

GFI Software develops essential applications for small and medium businesses. Over 80,000 customers choose GFI solutions for network management and performance, security, and collaboration applications. GFI Software available through thousands of channel partners dedicated to serving specific countries and regions worldwide.

GFI has a fully remote, global workforce. GFI has partnered with Crossover to administer its hiring and global workforce management.

job_description:
Mercer is seeking candidates for the following position, based in Mexico office:

Associate Digital Director

What can you expect?

This role plays an integral part in the digital & AI strategy formulation and execution, you’ll be working closely with the business leadership to ensure alignment of program goals to business priorities. You will be responsible for managing the Innovation & AI program in a manner consistent with the Mercer AI practices and methodologies. You will be the primary person working with all relevant teams and stakeholders (particularly executive leadership and senior management), creating compelling business cases, managing the delivery roadmap and report on progress, risks and issues.

You will be actively involved in identifying and delivering advanced technology opportunities based on Generative AI, New AI models, ChatBOT etc. You will also contribute and improve the delivery methodology and practice keeping pace with the market and new technologies.

What's in Marsh for you?
• A company with a strong brand and results to match.
• Opportunity to interact with different areas of Marsh and career growth.
• Employee resource groups that provide access to leaders, relevant volunteer and mentoring opportunities, and interactions with counterparts in industry groups and the client organisation.
• Benefits package and benefits above and beyond those provided by law.

What is in it for you?
• A competitive salary
• Employee friendly policies
• Health care and insurance for you and your dependants
• Healthy Work life balance
• A great working environment
• Flexible benefits packages to suit your needs and lifestyle

We will count on you:
• Articulate business opportunity into structured project/program and build + assess the business case.
• Design solution and get all the required stakeholders on the same page and seek approvals where required.
• Create and own the program roadmap, budgets, securing funding approvals where needed, and keeping all stakeholders informed of progress and potential roadblocks, and present well-organized information (amount/relevance)
• Provide program oversight across multiple ongoing implementations across businesses and drive governance and rigour across all workstreams and cross functional teams.
• Financials – manage budgets and forecast savings, and govern the NOI of the program as a whole, working closely with business owners and calibrating with the finance controls
• Ensure post implementation evaluations to monitor success of implementation against agreed baseline, enable and track benefits across releases, redeployments, cost avoidance, reduced capex / opex and top line inflows.
• Domain knowledge & applied responsibility: Keep abreast of advanced technologies within the digital space i.e. Generative AI, AGI, Blockchain, chatBOTs, Machine Learning,; and expand potential use cases for these technologies.
• Have and voice opinions with logical evaluation of options – thereby contributing towards differentiation of hype vs. real value, driving towards sound and timely investments or equally not-to-invest decisions.
• Engage and drive relationships / contracts and subscriptions with industry experts, analysts and academia to continually challenge status-quo and evolve best practices.
• Lead cross function team of workstream managers driving project level communication and consolidating upwards into program level communication and translating into proposed opinions and decisions for the senior leadership to deliberate upon
• Stakeholder management and relationship building across the full spectrum of stakeholders i.e. C-Suite level personnel, to business analysts, technology experts, process knowledge experts and vendor contact staff
• Directly project manage complex / high impact workstreams, including opportunity selection, scope, business cases, POCs, deployment and scale up.
• Risk management – analyse, anticipate and mitigate risk factors and work with the team and stakeholders to minimize risk. This includes working with R&C counterparts from various business lines at Op. Co as well as Group
• Lead R&C and Controls audits for the squads/ workstreams
• Ensure knowledge & skill development and team building for the colleagues in scope

What you need to have:

Technical Knowledge/ Expertise
• Excellent Product design, delivery and ownership
• Excellent project / program leadership skills with a keen sense of practical application of the concepts, with at least 5 years of relevant experience
• A minimum of 3 years of experience of budgeting, financial governance on large multi-team.
• Excellent knowledge of GenAI, ML and new age digital technologies and at least 1 years of relevant experience in leading relevant programs and initiatives
• A minimum of 2 years’ experience in leading change initiatives in the Career/ Wealth / Health consulting and administration businesses
• Knowledge and experience of product design, process re-engineering using design frameworks like design thinking.

General Skills:
• Excellent presentation skills – Experience in constructing proposals and business decks, including with a purpose to present at the C-Suite level.
• Excellent stakeholder management with experience of running senior management level meetings.
• Effective influencing, facilitation, and negotiation skills
• Conflict resolution - Must be able to facilitate discussion and alternatives or different approaches.
• Highly detail oriented by nature.
• Assertive – Ability to confidently put forward views in diverse groups.
• Enthusiastic – Must be high-energy.
• People Management – Minimum 3 years’ experience of managing multiple teams.
• Good negotiation skills

What makes you stand out?
• BTech/ MCA degree
• MBA degree from Tier 1 or 2 institution
• Knowledge and experience of the career, health, wealth consulting
• PMP or equivalent credentials in project management
• Relevant technology and digital-technology credentials
• Previous experience working with digital consulting or delivery for RPA, Chatbots, GenAI, ML etc.

Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC) is the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. The Company’s 85,000 colleagues advise clients in 130 countries. With annual revenue of over $20 billion, Marsh McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading businesses. Marsh provides data-driven risk advisory services and insurance solutions to commercial and consumer clients. Guy Carpenter develops advanced risk, reinsurance and capital strategies that help clients grow profitably and pursue emerging opportunities. Mercer delivers advice and technology-driven solutions that help organizations redefine the world of work, reshape retirement and investment outcomes, and unlock health and wellbeing for a changing workforce. Oliver Wyman s serves as a critical strategic, economic and brand advisor to private sector and governmental clients. For more information, visit marshmclennan.com, or follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.

Marsh McLennan is committed to hybrid work, which includes the flexibility of working remotely and the collaboration, connections and professional development benefits of working together in the office. All Marsh McLennan colleagues are expected to be in their local office or working onsite with clients at least three days per week. Office-based teams will identify at least one “anchor day” per week on which their full team will be together in person. Note: the changes to our hybrid work policy do not apply to officially designated remote workers and are subject to any works council or local legal requirement.

job_description:
At Qualtrics, we create software the world’s best brands use to deliver exceptional frontline experiences, build high-performing teams, and design products people love. But we are more than a platform—we are the creators and stewards of the Experience Management category serving over 18K clients globally. Building a category takes grit, determination, and a disdain for convention—but most of all it requires close-knit, high-functioning teams with an unwavering dedication to serving our customers.

When you join one of our teams, you’ll be part of a nimble group that’s empowered to set aggressive goals and move fast to achieve them. Strategic risks are encouraged and complex problems are solved together, by passing the mic and iterating until the best solution comes to light. You won’t have to look to find growth opportunities—ready or not, they’ll find you. From retail to government to healthcare, we’re on a mission to bring humanity, connection, and empathy back to business. Join over 6,000 people across the globe who think that’s work worth doing.

Software Engineering Manager - Engineering Services

Why We Have This Role

Qualtrics is seeking a Software Development Manager to join our growing Engineering function in our Mexico City office. If you have a Bachelor’s degree, have 5+ years of software engineering experience, and want work at a fast-growing tech company, Qualtrics could be the place you’ve been dreaming about.

Engineering Services (ES) plays an important role in the Qualtrics mission to "Build technology that closes experience gaps". The team is at the forefront of the relationship between Qualtrics and our customers. Our mission: We are the incubation engine for Qualtrics, powered by our deep relationships with our most sophisticated and strategic customers and our ability to rapidly capture value from emerging opportunities.

How You’ll Find Success
• Strong level of curiosity
• Ability to create trust in customers and teams through thorough communication
• Takes initiative and shows scrappiness in getting things done
• Proven ability to work well in teams - partnering with managers, cross functional teams, and teammates
• Takes analytical mindset to approach problems and find solutions
• Shows desire to learn new skills and grow in the role

How You’ll Grow

To support the continued growth of the Qualtrics XM customer base we are seeking a Software Development Manager to build and lead a team of talented and passionate software development engineers based in Mexico.

You will be someone experienced with the full spectrum of activities involved with building and scaling the growth of product teams to support the goals to develop our Mexico expansion into an engineering hub.

You will do this while also working across product, engineering, customers, sales, and professional services. This is an opportunity to part an amazing team and be a key leadership contributor at a company that is experiencing incredible growth.

Things You’ll Do
• Own engineering roadmap for the product and work with stakeholders to build quarterly plans
• Actively manage team or teams of employees, gathering and providing candid feedback, mentoring and coaching individuals and delegating appropriately
• Instill best practices for software development and documentation, assure designs meet requirements and deliver high-quality work on timely schedules
• Drive planning meetings, collaborate with your peers, prioritize features, and work with a sense of urgency to deliver value to your customers
• Guide your team to develop scalable and robust SaaS and PaaS solutions products to solve complex business problems.
• Work directly with our global clients to provide solutions and a great customer experience.
• Help us grow a Mexico site and global team of software engineers. Implement hiring plans and career development strategies for the engineering team

What We’re Looking For On Your Resume
• Managed and coached software developers ranging in experience from graduate level up to seasoned professionals.
• You are proactive and able to deliver on initiatives that you start; you get things done and have a proven record of doing so.
• You have a strong background and technical capabilities in object oriented design and development with languages such as; Java, .NET. C#, Python, Ruby, C++ etc.
• Experience building, owning and operating highly scalable, highly available internet facing software services.
• Experience with modern web development (JavaScript, CSS, HTML, Ruby on Rails)
• Experience with modern JavaScript frameworks such as Angular and D3
• A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related.
• 6 + years experience as software engineer and software development manager

Our Team’s Favorite Perks and Benefits
• We spend 10% of our time on individual engineering growth activities every quarter
• We participate in personalized Career Action Planning. You will work with your manager to design a plan based on your life experiences, values, and career aspirations (inside and outside Qualtrics) that helps you achieve your career goals at Qualtrics
• $1800 USD Experience bonus to be used for an “Experience” of your choosing
• Competitive salary, performance bonuses, generous savings fund match.
• Quarterly Wellness Reimbursement, can be used for activities including gym memberships, spa massages, workout equipment, meditation apps, and much more.
• Amazing QGroup Communities; MOSAIQ, Green Team, Qualtrics Pride, Q&Able, Qualtrics Salute, and Women’s Leadership Development, which exist as places for support, allyship, and advocacy.

Qualtrics is an equal opportunity employer meaning that all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected characteristic.

​​​​​​Applicants in the United States of America have rights under Federal Employment Laws: Family & Medical Leave Act, Equal Opportunity Employment, Employee Polygraph Protection Act

Qualtrics is committed to the inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, Qualtrics will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided with reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please let your Qualtrics contact/recruiter know.

Qualtrics Work Experience - As we look to the future, we believe that our teams are better together. Being together will help us learn more, grow faster and ultimately deliver better results for our customers and Qualtrics. Roles tied to an office location work 4 days per week in the office together and 1 day from home, with a strong spirit of flexibility around taking time for personal, health, and family moments in our work weeks. Our managers work with their teams to create a collaborative, engaged work environment, and arrangement that works for each of our team members.

Not finding a role that’s the right fit for now? Qualtrics Insiders is the one-stop shop for all things Qualtrics Life. Sign up for exclusive access to content created with you in mind and get the scoop on what we have going on at Qualtrics - upcoming events, behind the behind the scenes stories from the team, interview tips, hot jobs, and more. No spam - we promise! You'll hear from us two times a month max with fresh, totally tailored info - so be sure to stay connected as you explore your best role and company fit.

job_description:
The Dell Security & Resiliency organization manages the security risk across all aspects of Dell’s business. We are currently experiencing incredible growth in order to meet the security needs of the world’s largest technology company.

With team members located in over 15 countries, you will have an excellent opportunity to influence the security culture at Dell and further develop your career.

Join us as a Technical Program Manager on our Product and Application Security team in Mexico to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.

What you’ll achieve As a Security Engagement Manager, you will be responsible for supporting the Dell software engineering teams to help deliver the world’s most secure enterprise solutions to our customers.

This will be done by coordinating the resources of the Security and Resiliency Organization to perform holistic security reviews.

You will : Work across the Dell Digital engineering teams and Dell Technologies product teams to ensure the highest standards of secure software practices are followed.

Lead the effort to provide a multi-disciplinary security assessment for Dell offers. Provide offer team Program Management oversight over the Security Engagements across Dell divisions, Collaborate with the diverse and global product teams and with technical security advisors to raise the security posture of products.

Lead efforts to improve Security Engagements’ efficiency and effectiveness, Prepare and present to executive management the state of product security.

This requires a deep understanding of executive management perspective and priorities. Tailor the presentation of information to match the audience.

Raise the awareness of Product security risks and adoption of security requirements to upper management and offer team leadership, Analyze data from different sources and put a plan together for improvement.

Evangelize security across Dell divisions, Evaluate the current state of operations, defining a future state and initiatives to achieve it, Lead continuous improvement projects.

Take the first step towards your dream career! Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table.

Here’s what we are looking for with this role : Essential Requirements 2+ years of experience in Program Management and experience with Agile methodology Proven knowledge of engineering operations and product lifecycle process, tools and metric, Experience with functional disciplines such as Engineering, QA, Services, Product Management Knowledge with basic security concepts.

Experience working with data to assist with decision making Desirable Requirements Knowledge and experience with cloud platforms such as : Azure, AWS, Google Cloud and container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes Knowledge and experience in SDL (Secure Development Lifecycle)

job_description:
Ethicon, a part of Johnson & Johnson MedTech, is recruiting for a Program Manager supporting the Stratafix product family Value Stream. Within the Global Technical Operations group, this role is key in leading all supply chain technical aspects for the Stratafix Value Stream portfolio. This position is primarily based in Raritan, NJ, but open for being based in any J&J location In North or South America.

Are you ready to join a strong technical team supporting innovation and business growth? Then, this is the role for you!

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/. 

This program manager is responsible for leading the product and process platform aspects with a focus on technology and project portfolio, within this value stream. Working closely with the Value Stream leader in the orchestration of technical and strategic elements for the value stream.

Key Responsibilities:
• Develop and implement a strategic roadmap and master plan aligned with the WCH business Product Value Stream (PVSM) objectives in supply reliability, quality, growth, customer service, and cost.
• Ensure global alignment to enable outstanding technology and process engineering practices across our manufacturing sites.
• Program management and governance of the Product Value Stream (PVSM) project portfolio
• Collaborate with PVSM leaders, Product Management, Manufacturing Site Leadership, R&D, and other relevant functions do drive end-to-end (E2E) initiatives.
• Monitor and drive improvements in the business metrics performance as related to the assigned value stream.
• Lead complex E2E projects or programs across the PVSM supporting multiple sites.
• Champion the development and implementation of ground-breaking innovation as well as other major technology improvements over the strategic horizon
• Communicate platform portfolio priorities and updates.
• Cultivate external contacts and forge internal collaboration across all levels of the enterprise.
• Partner with equipment technology platform leaders and domain experts in the selection of best-in-class equipment and process technologies.
• Lead and develop technology roadmap for the PVSM
• Define and implement platform strategies supporting the implementation of engineering and E2E initiatives.
• Communicate business related issues or opportunities to the next management level.

job_description:
Continuous Improvement Manager
Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

To establish and maintain a continuous improvement culture in ABB, focusing on customers and quality, utilizing Lean Six Sigma methodology, and creating transparency to monitor progress.
In this role you will develop a common and consistent approach to continuous improvement and strategy. Customize strategy and help to spread best practices.
This is a position with global grade

11
This position reports to

Global Project Planning & Controls Mgr
Your responsibilities
• Partnering with business leaders to grasp goals and improvement needs in order to define a course of action.
• Working with business leaders to identify and access the best resources with which to work.
• Serving as a resource for customers’ continuous improvement efforts and stay there until they can sustain the work themselves.
• Training, mentoring and coaching business unit continuous improvement candidates and developing a pipeline of team members able to drive business results.
• Providing visibility over the current portfolio of continuous improvement efforts and tracking KPIs and value from these efforts to help allocate resources and recognize success.
• Driving cultural transformation with a hands-on (“gemba”) approach.
• Promoting behavioral change to continuously improve function performance through programs and initiatives.
• Ensuring that your area of responsibility is organized, staffed, skilled and directed, and developing the skills to create a highly effective and efficient team.

Your background
• Bachelor´s Degree in Industrial Engineering, IT degree or related.
• 5 years of experience working in similar position.
• Knowledge of SAP, Project Management and Process Management.
• Experience with switchboards and Finance is a plus.
• Availability to travel (15%).
• Advanced level of English.
• A collaborative, solution-focused approach, and strong written and spoken communication skills.

More about us

We look forward to receiving your application (documents submitted in English are appreciated). If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com.
Work model: on site #LI-onsite

job_description:
The Program Quality leader role is to support Automotive IT Core team in the development of new products for Premium OEMs.

The main responsabilities are:
• Establish and maintain successful Customer relationship on Quality matters
• Responsible for quality of delivered products and services to the Customer
• Initiate and monitor the Program Risk Assessment through FMEA methodology.
• Ensure effective root cause analysis and corrective actions
• Implement the quality management plan and ensure a regular follow-up to achieve these quality objectives throughout the program phases
• Work with ASQ to cascade these quality objectives to the internal and external suppliers
• Lead the development and production process for measurement, checking and testing fixtures and gauges (MSA studies, Capabilities, Gage R&R)
• In a collaboration with Program Development Leader and Industrial Program Engineer (at minimum) develops the required APQP elements of Special Characteristics, D/P-FMEA, and control plan until PPAP
• Is responsible for conformity, perceived quality and traceability of any parts delivered to the customer for prototype phase, first off tool, and preproduction
• Prepare the Production Part Approval Process (PPAP) files for submission of the initial samples, including customer process audit
• Report as needed the progress of his activity to Program Manager and TCS Director
• Ensure the use of the appropriate methods and quality standards (PMS, specific Customer program development system, international regulations, etc)
• Propose continuous improvement ideas in business efficiency and cost reduction
• Capitalizes on knowledge and shares best practices / lessons learned across organization and within the site

This job might be for you if you have:
• Knowledge of automotive quality standards and methods (ISO-9001, IATF-16949, VDA 6.3, APQP, PPAP, FMEA, MSA, SPC, etc.)
• Knowledge of:
• OEM specific quality requirements
• Company’s products and technologies
• Faurecia Management System and Quality Basics
• Skilled in Six Sigma
• Advanced skills in Microsoft applications (Excel, Word, Outlook, PowerPoint)
• Autonomy and Leadership mindset
• Capability to build and manage network
• Best practice sharing and improvement mindset
• Project Management Methodology
• Production System efficiency knowledge
• Process and Product knowledge
• Results oriented with strong written and oral communications skills
• Understand the group functional organization
• Proficient level of English

Welcome Home!

Benefits

• Seguro de Gastos Médicos Mayores (incluye plan dental y visión)
• 15 días de aguinaldo
• 25% de prima vacacional
• 12 días de vacaciones (A partir del primer año)

• PTU/Reparto de utilidades
• Vales de despensa quincenales

job_description: Position Summary: Responsible for manufacturing of products in planned quantities, at budgeted cost, safety and of desired quality. Liaisons with functional or operational area managers (e.g. in supply and logistics, or sales) to understand current and future product needs and develops plans, cost estimates, and schedules for integrating these needs into existing manufacturing activities. Provides supervision and guidance to Production Supervisors. Leads activities and projects to support continuous improvement in the areas of safety, quality, delivery, and cost reduction. Major Responsibilities: Coordinate and direct the work team to streamline processes. Supervise and evaluate performance of production personnel. Ensure the proper functioning of the production lines. Responsible for optimizing the productive resources of the company to obtain a progressive growth in productivity while respecting quality specifications. Minimize waste and achieve company goals. Enforce health and safety. Report to upper management. Budget Control HC Administration Monitoring compliance with KPIs Wide commitment to industrial safety. Required Education / Experience / Skills: Bachelor's degree or equivalent related experience. 3+ years (Engineering, Manufacturing, Production). Deep knowledge of production management Advanced knowledge of production processes, machinery, assembly lines and production standards. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Strong communication skills Troubleshooting and attention to detail. Knowledge of performance evaluation and budgeting concepts. Strong decision-making skills and a results-driven approach. Experience in reporting on key production metrics. Excellent organizational and leaderships skills. Proficiency in MS Office Bilingual Fluent English - Spanish Travel: Passport & US Visa (updated). Available to travel as required. About Regal Rexnord Regal Rexnord Corporation (“Regal Rexnord”) is a leading manufacturer of electric motors, electrical motion controls, power generation and mechanical power transmission products and sub-systems, serving customers around the world in the general industrial, consumer, commercial construction, food & beverage, and alternative energy end markets, among others. Regal Rexnord sells its products and solutions to OEMs, through distributors, and directly to end-users. Regal Rexnord is a $7.2B company with 36,000 associates globally. You may not know it, but Regal Rexnord impacts your life every day. The company’s products enable the fans in HVAC systems that keep us comfortable; the power source that keeps smart buildings running; the agricultural and food service equipment that keeps us fed; and the conveyer systems that keep e-commerce flowing, to name a few of the applications where our products are used. Regal Rexnord’s business purpose is to create a better tomorrow by energy-efficiently converting power into motion. This means creating innovative solutions while focusing on both customer needs and the company’s commitment to sustainability. The company’s industrial powertrain and automation solutions offerings are an important part of the company's growth strategy. The company’s strategy includes leveraging 80/20 to prioritize all activities, including product excellence, operational excellence and commercial excellence (i) driving organic sales growth through the introduction of innovative new products, with a particular focus on improving energy efficiency, (ii) establishing and maintaining new customers, as well as developing new opportunities with existing customers, (iii) participating in higher growth end markets and geographies, and (iv) identifying and consummating strategic, value creating acquisitions. At Regal Rexnord, our business purpose is to create a better tomorrow by energy-efficiently converting power into motion. As a leading producer of motors and related components, our essential products help keep systems running in mission-critical applications worldwide — indoor air quality products used in hospitals, homes, and senior living facilities; industrial products that support food and beverage, and pharmaceutical production; and conveying equipment and components that help warehouses function. What To Expect From Us Integrity A zero tolerance policy on unethical behavior. We value integrity most. We are honest, transparent, and trustworthy in all situations. Responsibility We have a responsibility to safety, sustainability, and our community. Diversity, Engagement & Inclusion We strongly believe that the more diverse minds focused on our purpose, the better the outcomes will be. We create an environment where all of associates can bring their best to Regal, develop and grow professionally, and work as one team to drive success for our customers, associates, and shareholders. Customer Success Our customer is our main priority. We must understand their needs and develop products, solutions and services that solve their challenges. Innovation with Purpose Through innovation we develop products and solutions that solve our customer's problems. We innovate to develop products that are valued by our customer and bring profitable growth for Regal. Continuous Improvement Our responsibility is to make tomorrow better than today. This means a focus on making the work easier, more productive, and more efficient. Performance We have a responsibility to all three of our primary stakeholders (customers, associates and shareholders) to drive profitable revenue growth. Passion to Win Passion is the fuel that inspires and drives our associates to achieve top performance. It helps us to overcome any obstacles in achieving our goals. ….with a Sense of Urgency Everything we do at Regal, we do with a sense of urgency. Not finding the right fit?
