job_description:
Associate Product Manager – OTIR

Are you passionate about the chance to bring your experience to a world-class company that is market-leading for both content and technology? If yes, we are looking for you!

Join our team! We are looking for customer-focused, collaborative, and strategic individuals with a strong passion for product leadership to join our Tax Information Reporting team in the role of Associate Product Manager. This position will focus the efforts on driving the prioritization and grooming of the backlog for their development teams.

About the Role
In this opportunity as an Associate Product Manager – OTIR, you will:
• Facilitate a process of continuous improvement through the collection and analysis of objective data, team inputs, and client-provided feedback.
• Drive operational excellence by managing ongoing operational activities associated with managing a large software product such as OKR tracking, roadmap maintenance, material code management, and annual assets/documents refresh.
• Project management of product releases and process improvement projects.
• Manage product enhancement requests to facilitate the development prioritization process.
• Manage client communities, the distribution of guides and release notes, and product announcements.
• Assist with preparations for Client Advisory Board meetings and Synergy Annual Conference.
• Assist with internal team communications, regulatory updates, team meetings and communication channels.
• Participate in cross-training opportunities.

About You

You’re a fit for the role if your background includes:
• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.  
• Fluent English.
• Must have a high-level proficiency in MS Office (mostly Excel and PowerPoint).
• Experience in Tax Information Reporting subject matter.
• Experience as a Product Manager, Product Owner, or Business Analyst in enterprise-class commercial business process software in finance, tax, or other B2B domains is a plus. 
• Demonstrated strong project management and facilitation skills to drive consensus with cross-functional resources.
• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Strong organizational and interpersonal skills.
• Demonstrated ability to manage across boundaries, exerting influence without authority, and collaboration between groups. 
• Strong written and verbal communication skills in English language including presentations, project plans, and status reports.
• Eager to learn and willing to take self-initiative.

To apply, please upload your updated resume in English.

Location: CDMX

What’s in it For You?

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:
• Hybrid Work Model: We’ve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected.
• Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
• Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
• Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking.
• Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
• Purpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

#LI-ZM1

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 26,000 employees across more than 70 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

Accessibility

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

Protect yourself from fraudulent job postings click here to know more.

More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on https://thomsonreuters.com.

job_description:
Highlights:
• Remote in Brazil, Mexico, or Argentina
• Base Salary: $34,400 - $43,200
• OTE: $43,000 - $54,000
• Generous stock options

About Fundraise Up

Fundraise Up is a rapidly growing financial technology company headquartered in Brooklyn, NY, that provides online fundraising software to enterprise nonprofits. Fundraise Up's AI-powered platform is leveraged by trusted organizations like UNICEF USA, American Heart Association, Partners In Health, and Stand Up to Cancer, to double their recurring donor acquisition rates and increase overall digital donation revenue by two times.

About the Role

Join Fundraise Up as a Senior Product Marketing Manager and play a pivotal role in bridging the gap between our product offerings and customer needs. Your mission will be to collaborate closely with diverse teams, including marketing, engineering, sales, and customer success, to ensure our solutions resonate deeply with the challenges and opportunities faced by our users.

Key Responsibilities
• Be responsible for developing product marketing briefs, messaging documents, competitive positioning, internal product training content, and external communication strategy for launches and in-market programs for existing and prospective customers.
• Constantly monitoring competitive activity, identifying customer needs and interacting with engineering, operations, and sales to bring innovative new products to market.
• Represent the voice of the customer across the organization. Amongst other deliverables, this manifests as differentiated messaging, positioning, and audience segmentation that is leveraged across the organization for internal and external use.
• Contribute to a customer reference program to curate and showcase customers' success across various industries and use cases.
• Possess expert knowledge of the competitive landscape. Develop and maintain sales tools and resources for the sales team to tell the story.
• Work with marketing team members across content, design, and web development to plan and execute new product launch campaigns.
• Collaborate with engineering to help align marketing priorities and programs with the product and business roadmap.

Skills and Qualifications
• 5+ years of experience in product marketing, preferably in B2B, SaaS.
• Strong understanding of product marketing principles and experience developing go-to-market plans.
• Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex concepts clearly.
• Experience with digital marketing tools and platforms, including CRM and analytics software (Hubspot, Salesforce).
• You are both a self-starter and a team player.
• You are excited to learn and continuously improve.

What We Offer

Our compensation package includes comprehensive benefits and perks, meaningful equity, and a competitive salary:
• Home Office Setup Assistance: office chair, office desk, monitor.
• English learning courses (50% reimbursement, up to $1,000 annually).
• Relevant professional education (50% reimbursement, up to $1,500 annually).
• Gym or swimming pool (50% reimbursement, up to $500 annually).
• Coworking (up to $250 monthly).

job_description:
Entreprise familiale, bioMérieux est un acteur mondial dans le domaine du diagnostic in vitro. Depuis 60 ans, partout dans le monde, nous concevons et développons des solutions diagnostiques innovantes pour améliorer la santé des patients et des consommateurs. Aujourd'hui, nos équipes sont présentes dans 45 pays et servent 160 pays grâce à un large réseau de distributeurs.
Rejoindre bioMérieux, c’est choisir une société familiale et humaniste, portée par une vision long terme, au service de la santé publique dans le monde.

As a key member of our dynamic team, you’ll shape the future of our diagnostic IT solutions. Your role involves driving innovation, collaborating with cross-functional stakeholders, and ensuring the success of our upstream product portfolio. Specifically, you’ll oversee the AMR National Surveillance IT platform, a secure cloud-based software-as-a-service that plays a crucial role in safeguarding public health, preserving effective antibiotics, and mitigating antimicrobial resistance. This platform enables real-time monitoring, data collection, collaboration, and predictive modeling, ultimately empowering national authorities to make informed decisions and enhance patient care.

What will be your responsabilities?
• Vision and Strategy: Develop a clear vision for the upstream product line, aligning it with the company strategy. Define roadmaps and long-term goals.
• Market Insights: Understand customer needs, competitive landscape, and trends. Identify opportunities for differentiation and growth.
• Product Development: Collaborate with R&D, engineering, and design teams to translate market insights into product requirements. Drive new diagnostic solutions.
• Lifecycle Management: Manage the entire product lifecycle, from concept to end-of-life. Continuously improve based on feedback.
• Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with marketing, sales, regulatory affairs, and clinical teams for successful product launches.

Who are you?
• Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a relevant field (microbiology, pharmarcy, epidemiology).
• Minimum 5 years of experience in product management, preferably in the diagnostics or healthcare industry.
• Knowledgeable in infection prevention and antimicrobial resistance
• Strong analytical skills, strategic thinking, and ability to drive results.
• Excellent communication and leadership abilities.
• Fluent in English
• IT/Analytics experiences

job_description:
100% remote job

Product Development Manager | Jules | Mexico

Hi there! We are Jules and our client is looking for a Product Development Manager!
• This position is open for people residing in LATIN AMERICA**

About The Position

As a Product Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing the entire product development lifecycle, from initial ideation to launch and beyond. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to translate customer needs and market insights into compelling product solutions. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in project management and a demonstrated ability to organize and execute complex processes effectively.

Key Responsibilities
• Lead the development of new products from concept to commercialization, ensuring alignment with company goals and customer needs.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including design, engineering, marketing, and manufacturing, to define product requirements and develop project plans.
• Conduct market research and analysis to identify market trends, competitive landscapes, and customer preferences.
• Define and prioritize product features and enhancements based on customer feedback, market data, and business objectives.
• Develop and maintain project schedules, budgets, and resource allocations to ensure timely and cost-effective delivery of products.
• Manage the product development process, including milestone tracking, risk management, and issue resolution.
• Communicate project status, updates, and key decisions to stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
• Drive continuous improvement initiatives to optimize product development processes and increase efficiency.
• Monitor product performance post-launch and collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement product improvements and enhancements.

Requirements
• Advanced spoken and written English
• Proven track record of success in product management or project management
• Knowledge of product development processes, including design thinking, agile development, and stage-gate methodologies.
• Experience with project management tools and methodologies.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate market insights into actionable product strategies.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with diverse teams and stakeholders.
• Bachelor’s degree in business, engineering, marketing, or a related field (not mandatory)

If this opportunity sounds good to you, send us your resume!

Show more

Show less

job_description:
Product Manager

We are looking to meet our Product Manager, to join our office in CDMX, Lisbon or Remote, and contribute to our mission of democratizing K12 Education in Latam.

As Luca’s Product Manager, you willbe responsible for defining, refining and executing the product roadmap and backlog based on the product vision. You will be working closely with the Head of Product to achieve our product objectives and key results. Also, you will be responsible to drive main metrics of engagement and retention of our product.

Who are you?

You know what empathy is and like autonomy. You are also self motivated and energetic, believing that this planet would be much better through better education.

You love a fast-paced environment, but you also know that “fast-paced” can be incredibly fun, zen and supportive... ah, and you are not arrogant and treat people the same way you would like to be treated.

You should be goal-oriented and keen to implement processes, automations and work with no-code tools if that’s the best solution. You can work without much supervision or mentorship, but you don't mind asking if needed (after you tried, or asked father Google).

Last but not least, you thrive under pressure and are used to delivering high quality work, many times exceeding expectations.

Your responsibilities…
• Understand main drivers for customer retention and churn, and design actions and product features to improve these metrics
• Manage and prioritize product backlog items
• Gather input from users to include in product backlog
• Communicate product backlog to other stakeholders in Luca and manage timeline expectations
• Measure and monitor progress to ensure releases are delivered on time and within budget.
• Manage relationships and coordinate work between different teams.

Your skills and experience
• Experience working in Technology Product Management, Software Engineering, and/or Digital B2C Products
• Experience in owning retention and engagement metrics for digital products
• Experience in EdTech sector is a plus
• Analytical and quantitative skills and the ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop business cases
• Ability to clearly communicate data insights and product roadmap to others
• Work experience with Agile methodology (e.g. Jira tool)
• Ability to partner with Operations, Product, and Growth teams at all levels
• Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills, with the ability to interact efficiently with technical and non-technical groups
• Fluent in English & Spanish, both written and verbal
• Experience in analyzing data sets in SQL is a strong plus

Why join Luca?

Because we love what we do and we are always aiming to hire better people than us. At Luca you will have the rare chance to work in a vibrant and energizing start-up culture with flat hierarchies and with very clear core values: empathy, autonomy and fun.

❤️People - Treat colleagues and clients as you would treat your family, always.

   Autonomy - You, your opinions, and actions are appreciated, but do it responsibly.

  ️Fun - Have fun, go remote, party, in a way you collaborate to build the best educational platform of the world

We are a diverse decentralized team with offices in Madrid, Lisbon, Barcelona and Mexico City (and counting!). We have no space for arrogance, empty corporate bs, lack of empathy or mistreatment. We treat people as we would treat our family, for real, and we also believe that people should have fun, flexibility and good perks, but knowing that hard working is very important to build something great (mental health friendly:).

Sounds like a plan? Apply to the job and let's make it happen.

At Luca you can also:
• Work in one of the Fastest growing Edtech companies in the region
• Be in the best place to be challenged and be part of a fun team at the same time.
• Many more benefits are coming soon…

More about Luca

Luca's learning platform provides learning programs for primary and secondary school students.

The learning platform offers pre-recorded K12 videos, gamified content and AI powered personalized study paths, covering the entire official academic curriculum and national exams prep.

Our founding team includes ex Uber, Netflix, McKinsey, Morgan Stanley, Crehana, Byjus, Santillana, ThePowerMBA, Cisco, IE Business School.

Since starting the company in Q4 2020, we have:

   Raised our $3M Pre-Seed round from Heartcore, Shilling and Edtech & Tier 1 Business Angels such as the Founders & CEOs of IronHack, The Power MBA, Pearson Education, Unbabel, Cobee plus C-Levels and Board Members at Descomplica, EQT, Hedosophia, EDP, Kroton and Kibo Ventures

   Scaled the team to more than 40 people

   Built and launched our Beta Desktop Platform + over 200 classes

   Ran Pilots in over 40 schools & 3k students in Mexico & Colombia & Guatemala,

validating our assumption that Luca's curriculum is fit for the Spanish speaking region as a whole

   Validated usage metrics on our platform: Luca's average session time is already 3x higher than that of the most sold product in the Region ( Compartir by Editorial Santillana)

   Started the sales process last week for our schools: 20% of the pilot schools have already bought the program for next school year

   Achieved industry leading NPS at 84 , above 51 Education sector average NPS

At Luca, You will be working in an environment where everything you do is incredibly important to the end product and success of the company. Your actions and decisions will shape the future of the company & of the education sector as a whole.

As we move into our next phase of growth, we're looking for passionate and dedicated people to focus on innovative solutions while positioning the company for hyper growth. That, in part, means finding top candidates who want to invest their energy & talent in helping us achieve our mission: to democratize education. We empower our team to make the right decisions, at the right time, always thinking of the students, their parents and the future.

We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone has access to quality and affordable education, everywhere at anytime. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s change the education sector for good, together.

Luca Learning Systems focuses on Education, K-12 Education, Education Technology, and Mobile Application. Their company has offices in Madrid. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees. To date, Luca Learning Systems has raised $360k of funding; their latest round was closed on November 2020.

You can view their website at https://lucaedu.com/

job_description:
Why work with us?

We are a fast-growing company that is revolutionizing the world of data in Latin America!

CIAL Dun & Bradstreet is the leading provider of business decisioning solutions and commercial data across Latin America and the Caribbean. Our solutions are designed to transform how businesses manage risk and make critical decisions about the companies they rely on.

At CIAL, we firmly believe that every team member plays a critical role towards achieving our goal of enabling businesses to thrive in any economic environment.

It’s our people, not technology, that makes what we do possible. It’s our people, not data, that turns information into insights. And it’s our people, not algorithms, that cares to help our clients make better informed decisions.

We are innovative, agile, and inspired by data – and we are looking for people that share those values to join our mission to build stronger businesses!

Join the data-revolution!

Position Description

We’re looking for a Product Manager for our Data and Reports solution area. You’ll work with a cross-functional team responsible for delivering our next generation Data and Reports to some of the leading brands across Latin America. You’ll work in close collaboration with stakeholders from across the business including engineering, data science, analytics, and senior leadership. We’re looking for someone with the same passion that we have for insightful solutions with a big impact.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
• Define the product roadmap for a cross functional development team
• Understand customer’s needs for credit and supplier (procurement) decisioning, understand our data and the best way to deliver it to customers (reports, data blocks, APIs) and how to differentiate us from competition
• Develop and maintain a comprehensive backlog to deliver on the product vision and road map in collaboration with tech leads; Obsessively gather market input and competitive intelligence to update the backlog accordingly
• Define scope documents for the development teams
• Work with business teams in multiple geographies and product managers across the company to build business cases, set strategy and define requirements and timelines
• Regularly communicate roadmaps, progress, risks and change control to senior management.
• Explore AI and embed its strategically to transform our product experiences.
• Participate in strategic sales opportunities to confirm customer requirements and support sales team members in learning how to best communicate customer key value propositions
• Ship fast and often with a vigilant focus on customer success.

KEY REQUIREMENTS
• 3+ years product experience including product strategy, product development, data scientist or API development
• Experience and familiarity with data, report and/or API products
• 2+ years with an Internet, Big-Data, e-commerce, SaaS, cloud software, data providers and/or financial services companies
• Fluency in Spanish and English
• Voracious appetite for discovering and designing the “whole product” experience
• Leadership—you can motivate your teammates to build amazing products. You’re great at making tough decisions in a sea of ambiguity and keeping everyone on track
• Technical know-how—you have ability to work with data, json and APIs
• Demonstrated ability to coordinate projects across functional teams, including technical, engineering, operations and design teams
• Demonstrated ability with sales teams to identify customer needs and deliver differentiated solutions
• Background in statistics or data science and how they inform product experiences
• Comfort working with remote co-workers.
• High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously

What we offer:
• Positive and encouraging work environment.
• Dynamic company where you can grow as far as your vision and curiosity leads you.
• Competitive compensation and benefits package.
• Hybrid work scheme.
• Office: Santa Fe, CDMX.
• CIAL provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. This applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, and transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.*

job_description:
Marketing Product Manager – Mobile Wallet

Who are we?

IPF Digital is a Financial Services company part IPF Group and trades as Creditea in México. We provide consumer loans, and our mission is to make life easier by offering simple and personalized financial solutions to everyday Mexicans.

Our organizational purpose is to build a better world through financial inclusion, and we see the role Marketing Product Manager – Mobile Wallet as being critical in shaping and persevering our organizational culture that is centred around our purpose.

At IPF Digital we are committed to promoting strategies that help us maintain a balance between our personal and work lives, where each of our employees feels motivated and is reflected in business results.

You'll join a highly engaged team ready to help you make your adaptation very easy and simple, and together achieve goals.

The role

This is a high visibility, high impact role that’s primary objective is to bring customer input, partnerships, and business opportunities to feed definition of IPFD’s portfolio and execute global strategy with effective implementation product and CEX solutions on the Mexican market. You will be responsible for maximization of usage and engagement of our customers in the Creditea Mobile Wallet (mobile self-service app) and looking for monetization opportunities of the service.

The Responsibilities

1. Product definition and growth
• Through market analysis, research and monitoring bringing the knowledge and insights to the company about mobile lending and CEX solutions existing on MX market that allow to shape IPFD’s roadmap.
• Bringing the knowledge and insights to the company about consumer needs and requirements related to lending/banking mobile solution that will maximize customer satisfaction and engagement.
• Co-creation and development of a Product and Innovation Strategy, operational policy, and framework for MX market.
• Creation of value-added services agenda, actively driving partnerships, define business requirements and business case for those services.
• Co-definition with design and UX team customer journeys relevant for the MX customers and MX mobile wallet.
• Taking direct ownership and leadership of key strategic product and innovation developments as required.
• Owning product business cases.
• Creating go-to-market plans and launching products and particular functionalities on MX market (commercialization).
• Identifying appropriate opportunities to maximize sales – this will include external innovations and ideas.
• Providing the scope and priorities to development process closely cooperating with development teams (product “factory”).
• Sharing best practice and ideas across IPFD.
• Responsibility for the commercial success of introduced products.

2. External Focus & Insight
• Well-connected externally, you will constantly be looking for new innovations and opportunities for IPF Digital to deliver upon its organizational Purpose.
• Build long lasting relationships externally and internally, role model for others across the organization on how to do this.
• Stay up to date with external developments and trends and act as an advisor to IPFD leadership teams to share insight and knowledge to shape strategy.
• Assess market competition by comparing the company's product to competitors' products.
• Build key external partnerships and networks, seeking to maximize opportunities for strategic partnerships.
• Provide customer insight, awareness, and information to IPFD leadership team to help to shape developments and strategic thinking.
• Understand the global marketplace and bring this knowledge and insights to IPFD.

So, what skills, knowledge, and experience do you have?

Skills
• Fluent in verbal and written business English (essential).
• Business models acumen in Value Added Services.
• Expert in product development.
• Strong project management skills.
• Assertive and able to influence senior leaders and gain buy-in through co-creation for IPFD projects.
• Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to deal with colleagues at all levels an across all functions and territories.
• Excellent communication skills with the ability to deliver impactful presentations and deal with external partners.
• Cultural awareness and empathy.
• Commercial and Strategic awareness.

Knowledge & Experience
• Business Development.
• Product design.
• Innovation.
• Process excellence.
• Mobile technology.
• Customer experience and customer journeys.
• Worked within digital or fintech (Desirable).
• Experience in driving sales, personally and working as part of a start-up (Desirable).
• Credit Cards (Desirable).
• Worked within business development environment – partners management.
• Project Management – Agile understanding and experience.

What we can offer you
• Work with the best team in a startup environment.
• Hybrid working model.
• Work Leave Permissions additional to the Law.
• Work Life Balance Program with different initiatives.
• Free Lunch once per week.
• Various team building events throughout the year.
• Unlimited online Medical Attention, Psychological and Nutritional Advisory.
• Self – care.

Sounds good?

If your answer is yes, please send us your CV.

Only short – listed candidates will be contacted. All short – listed candidates will be invited to do an initial online screening as part of the recruitment process.

IPF Digital México is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and we value diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We seek to recruit, develop, and retain the most talented people from diverse cultures, perspectives, skill, and experiences within our workforce.

All employment will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs

job_description:
Available Locations: Remote Mexico or Remote US

What you'll do

We are looking for a strong leader to join our team as part of the Finance & Business Operations Organization. As a key team member of a high-visibility organization, this role will provide both technical and operational support to Cloudflare’s Global Commissions Tooling & Strategy.

Responsibilities
• Lead Strategic Direction, Product Vision, Customer Discovery, Feature Prioritization & Cross-functional alignment for Cloudflare’s Commission Tech Stack
• Identify & implement leading practice architecture and build techniques, optimizing for scalability, flexibility and analytical intelligence
• Own & coordinate managed services resources, leveraging to execute and implement builds, enhancements and testing
• Implement robust and thorough change management processes and testing framework
• Employ a ‘business-focused’ approach to technical work; learn, understand and speak the language of key stakeholders and business partners
• Build extensive documentation and enablement infrastructure, scaling consistent practices, documentation and desktop procedures for tool functionality
• Build deep knowledge around and leverage relationships to influence outcomes and prioritization of upstream system enhancements which directly impact ICM practice (eg. HCM, CRM, etc.)
• Implement appropriate SOX Controls, partnering closely with the Controllership and Internal Audit Organizations

Examples of desirable skills, knowledge and experience
• 8+ years of Product Management, Technical Project Management, Consulting, or Incentive Compensation Administration; experience with a Saas business model preferred
• Firm grasp of the commission administrative process flow, including plan document distribution and tracking; transaction crediting; incentive calculations; payment file preparation; and issue resolution
• Experience or understanding of commissions-specific SOX Controls
• Experience with Varicent, Anaplan ICM, Xactly, Calidus or a similar ICM tool
• Experience with SQL platforms and queries
• Communication: Clear, concise communicator; ability to synthesize complex data or business problems into actionable information to drive results
• Versatility: Ability to multitask and thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth environment, zooming in with good attention to detail while still keeping the big picture in mind
• Project Management: Results-oriented, self-starter, organized, team-focused, and a strong work ethic, leveraging relationships to ensure deadlines are met

escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency, as well as effectively supervise the activity of others and create accountability with those who fail to maintain these standards. job_description:
Product Manager Microbiología México

Estamos en la búsqueda de un Product Manager de Microbiología, quien trabajará y crecerá dentro del Departamento de Marketing, reportando directamente al Gerente de Marketing, dentro de un equipo de 6 personas.

Esta posición estará basada en la Ciudad de México con una disponibilidad para viajar del 60%.

El Product Manager será responsable de la estrategia de corto, mediano y largo plazo (LCM) de los productos BioMérieux, productos de la línea de Microbiología de BioMérieux, tomando como parámetro lineamientos de marketing Global y Regional.

¿Cuáles serán sus responsabilidades dentro de bioMérieux?

• Implementar las estrategias de marketing con la fuerza de ventas, asegurando el entendimiento necesario para que generen los resultados esperados.
• Hacer seguimiento de auditorías e informes de mercado para monitorear a los competidores y proponer planes de acción.
• Asegurar que la fuerza de ventas tenga los medios para difundir mensajes promocionales a las audiencias objetivo-definidas en la estrategia.
• Establecer relación con sociedades médicas y KOL del mercado para prospectar y cerrar alianzas. Conocimiento de toda la cadena involucrada en el cierre de una venta compleja y detección de oportunidades y puntos de corrección.
• Interactuar con las áreas de soporte de la empresa (financiera, legal, regulatoria, asuntos médicos, administración de ventas, ingeniería, etc.) con el fin de obtener información y/o resolver problemas pendientes con los clientes.
• Tener relación funcional y constante con la región de marketing para la alineación e implementación de las estrategias para este producto.
• Asignar y gestionar eficientemente el presupuesto promocional para maximizar los resultados de las estrategias relacionadas.

Estudios y Experiencia:

- Licenciatura en Administración de empresas o carreras relacionadas con Marketing, Farmacéutica, Bioquímica o Microbiología.
- DeseablePostgrado o MBA en Marketing o Gestión Empresarial
- 6 años de experiencia en puestos equivalentes en empresas de IVD, Dispositivos Médicos, Farmacéuticas y/o Ciencias de la Salud.
- Deseable experiencia en estructuras matriciales y ambientes multiculturales.

Habilidades y Calificaciones:
- Experiencia en liderazgo de proyectos o equipos de al menos 3 años.
- Capacidad de simplificación, priorización, agilidad y mejora de procesos.
- Planeación y organización; Capacidad de innovación y aprendizaje; creatividad
- Buenas relaciones interpersonales con áreas de soporte, habilidades de comunicación efectiva.
- Empuje/ Comunicación Asertiva/ Autonomía/ Creatividad/ Trabajo en Equipo/Liderazgo por Influencia
- Nivel de Inglés intermedio/avanzado indispensable.

Trabajar en bioMérieux significa estar involucrado a largo plazo con una empresa pionera, visionaria y en constante crecimiento que permite a sus empleados vivir una experiencia estimulante e inspiradora en un ambiente de trabajo satisfactorio.

Nuestra política de movilidad interna ofrece numerosas oportunidades para que cada uno de nuestros 13.000 empleados prospere a lo largo de su carrera, respetando al mismo tiempo los talentos individuales de cada empleado, así como su desarrollo personal y profesional.

En bioMérieux, más de 200 profesiones, tanto científicas como no científicas, ofrecen a nuestros empleados la oportunidad de ampliar sus campos de especialización y desarrollar carreras multifuncionales. Brindamos una experiencia gratificante en una empresa internacional que reúne talentos de diversos orígenes, fomentando así una aspiración diaria de ir más allá de los límites.

Ayudar a mejorar la salud pública en todo el mundo: nuestra misión da propósito a cada profesión que se practica dentro de la empresa.

bioMérieux es un empleador que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades y acción afirmativa. Discapacidad/Orientación sexual/Identidad de género/GINA.

job_description:
About Kueski

Founded in 2012 with the mission to improve the financial lives of people in Mexico, Kueski is the leading buy now, pay later (BNPL) and online consumer credit platform in Latin America, known for its innovative financial services. Its flagship product, Kueski Pay, allows customers to make purchases and pay later, both online and in physical stores and has become the payment choice for a quarter of Mexico's leading e-commerce merchants. Notably, it stands out as the first buy now, pay later (BNPL) option accessible to Mexican consumers on Amazon.com.mx.

Kueski is frequently recognized for its strong, diverse and inclusive company culture. In 2022, Kueski was named one of the most ethical companies in Mexico by AMITAI, and one of the best companies for both young professionals and female talent in Mexico by EFY. The company has also been named to CB Insights’ Fintech 250 list.

Purpose

As the Product Manager IV for Personal Loans at Kueski, you will be part of the strategy and product management of our personal loans portfolio. You will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of financial solutions for millions of consumers in Mexico, profoundly impacting their financial well-being and access to credit. In this role, you are not just managing a product; you are revolutionizing the personal finance landscape by providing innovative, reliable, and accessible loan solutions.

Key Responsibilities
• Strategy Development: Craft and execute a comprehensive strategy for Kueski's personal loans product line, focusing on scalability, customer satisfaction, and market expansion
• Product Ownership: Take full ownership of the personal loans portfolio, ensuring its success by driving product enhancements, optimizing user experience, and maintaining high-quality standards
• Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with engineering, design, marketing, finance, and other teams to deliver product enhancements and innovations that align with business goals and customer needs
• Data-Driven Decision Making: Utilize analytics, user feedback, and market research to inform product decisions, ensuring alignment with customer demands and business objectives
• Market Impact: Make a significant contribution to the company’s mission by providing accessible and innovative financial solutions that address the needs of underserved consumers in Mexico
• Vision and Leadership: Develop and communicate a clear vision for the personal loans product, inspiring and guiding cross-functional teams to achieve exceptional results and business growth
• Develop requirements for engineering teams that integrate customer insights and collaborate with our design team to create simple, elegant, and innovative interfaces
• Conduct user testing and gather feedback to identify areas for improvement and ensure a seamless user experience
• Partner with different teams to define and execute research efforts to inform and validate product direction
• Define key performance indicators (KPIs) and manage the release cycles of our applications to continuously drive product improvement
• Leverage analytics and qualitative customer insights to identify potential opportunities, identify efficient ways to validate hypotheses, and track live performance to eat a rate and further improve the business
• Run basic financial models to assess the potential impact of features and make go/no-go decisions: Identify potential opportunities and assess their potential impact on the business by running basic financial models

Position Requirements
• At least 5 years of product management experience with 3-5 years of experience in financial services or fintech
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a track record of using data to drive product decisions
• Excellent leadership and collaboration abilities, with experience leading cross-functional teams to deliver high-impact projects
• Deep understanding of the financial services industry, particularly personal loans, with insights into consumer behavior and market trends
• Ability to articulate product vision and strategy effectively to stakeholders at all levels
• Passion for innovation and a commitment to delivering user-centered solutions that make a positive difference in people's lives
• Ability to work in a startup or fast-paced and agile development environment
• Strong analytical and communication skills: Ability to interpret large amounts of data and work with cross-functional teams to drive product improvements
• It's important to think analytically about existing processes and how to improve them
• Customer-centric mindset with a focus on understanding and meeting the needs of our users, with the ability to translate user feedback into actionable insights
• Collaboration and leadership skills, including experience working with cross-functional teams and leading projects to successful outcomes
• Fluency in both Spanish and English

You’ll love working at Kueski because:
• We have a mission-driven culture focused on customer value, teamwork, humility, and integrity.
• Everyone is expected to have role clarity, career growth, and a personal development plan. Feedback and recognition is embedded in our company processes, systems, and practices.
• We ensure competitive salary, medical insurance, and wellbeing through ample and flexible time off as well as mental healthcare benefits. Everyone is an owner and eligible for competitive stock options with a company poised for success.
• We're committed to building an inclusive and diverse team and we know this leads to incredible work.

job_description:
With hundreds of millions of users and tens of thousands of business customers from every industry and region in the world, Office 365 is the locomotive that is driving Microsoft's leadership in cloud services. The Office 365 core platform is critical to the success of Office 365 and a foundational ingredient in every productivity experience and intelligent service built in the Microsoft Cloud. This platform underpins new apps and services built by Microsoft and third parties, growing rapidly into the user-centric cloud services ecosystem that will help realize the step change in productivity promised by next generation machine intelligence.
The Office 365 Core Directory and Identity team is looking for a Principal Product Manager to help lead modernization of the directory and authentication spaces. The role will focus on bringing the future vision for these aeras while working with Entra ID and various workloads and apps across the whole Microsoft ecosystem of first-party partners.
Responsibilities
Key functions include:
- Provide strategy, vision, product or technical white papers that?must be presented to very senior stakeholders and executives.?
- Drive modernization of Identity, authentication, and authorization platform across M365. Work with other Identity leaders and partner teams to build a compelling and secure platform story around these scenarios.
- Imagine, design, and drive a rapid roadmap of improvements that guide the team towards new scenarios and next generation Identity experiences demanded by customers.
- Solve and simplify complex problems in scale, availability, performance, security and cost areas, as the platform serves many apps at massive scale with tight SLA requirements. ?
- Work with partner teams to understand needs and translate them to well defined and prioritized scenarios & requirements and plans to resolve any issues.? Help build strong relationships with partners as they build on our platform.?
- Define Objectives and Key results?along with metrics (KPIs) and SLAs to measure success of our platform investments. Design monitoring?capabilities and telemetry to support the SLA agreements with partners ?
Other
- Embody our culture (https://careers.microsoft.com/v2/global/en/culture) and values (https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/about/corporate-values)
Qualifications
Required Qualifications to Include:?
- 7+ years' experience in Product Management (key emphasis) or Technical Product Management ?
- Experience in Identity, authentication, authorization platforms are preferred but not required?
- Must be a highly driven individual, able to operate with less supervision, build plans, drive clarity in pursuing the outcomes we want?
- Great writing skills and communication capabilities to senior leadership are a must have.?
- Must have sound technical knowledge of security and cloud-based platforms & databases. Ability to easily grasp high cloud scale & distributed architectures. Must be able to go deep or broad as needed and work with senior architects and technical fellows. Hands-on experience in these areas via strategy paper, specs, blogs, operational experiences ?
- Track record of being a creative problem solver for technical or product issues. Has an eye to innovate and deliver platform capabilities that provide high impact. Deep focus on customers means delivering awesome and secure experiences & capabilities for our application developers.?
- Outstanding collaboration and partnership skills. Ability to influence partners is key in helping build relationships with empathy and managing conflicts while pursuing the right outcomes for our customers & service. ?
- Leadership ability to lead groups & discussions across very senior architects and engineers. Adept in creating the?right agendas, moving discussions forward and making solid progress towards the outcomes. Tracking hard problems end-end across partner teams. Experience working in leadership roles is preferred but not required.?
- Learning new technologies, AI model and security protocols, incorporate plans and ideas to leverage them ?
- Experience working with enterprise customers, both technical and business, and at all levels
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations (https://careers.microsoft.com/v2/global/en/accessibility.html) .

job_description:
Product Manager for Industrial IEC Motors
Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

Working as a Product Manager, you will be a key member of the marketing and sales team in Motion NEMA and IEC Motors, defining marketing plans, including marketing communication, training and sales initiatives. In this role, you will oversee all steps in the life cycle of products, systems or services, including development, launch, maintenance, pricing and profitability of IEC induction motors in Mexico
This is a position with global grade

13
This position reports to

Marketing & Sales Manager
Your responsibilities
• Driving the profitability and life cycle of products and services by defining pricing guidelines and market position.
• Overseeing inventory levels and sales volumes to ensure ability to meet customer orders, while tracking and analyzing the performance and trends of products and services
• Working closely with R&D to propose and evaluate product feasibility projects and roadmaps for new products and services.
• Providing technical and commercial assistance to the sales team.
• Working closely with the HR team to ensure is properly organized, staffed and directed.
• Guiding, coaching and developing the skills and knowledge of the sales team.

Your background
• Bachelor’s Degree in Electro-Mechanic or Electronic Engineering.
• 5 years of experience in sales and experience with IEC motors and/or electric products sales.
• Market analysis and sales strategy.
• Proficient with Microsoft Office, SAP, Sales Force and Abacus.
• Availability to travel.
• Advanced English level.

More about us

We look forward to receiving your application (documents submitted in English are appreciated). If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com.
Work model: hybrid #LI-hybrid

job_description:
Product & Price Coordinator.

As Product & Price Coordinator you'll be responsible of Product planning / launch management through definition of the market specific product strategy considering price, volume, and revenue forecast. As well as definition of a market adequate price positioning for the given product offer in coordination with headquarters.

Responsibilities.
• Adaption of centrally provided products for specific market product offer, e.g., adaption of performance according to the law (standard profiles, packages).
• Steering of concept development and time scheduling of product specific sales management measures for target achievement LCI measures.
• Launch preparation and market introduction as well as go-to-market measures for services.
• Concept development of short-term and product measures which flow back to headquarters as best practice in a long-mid-term planning.
• Execution of annual product and price measures.
• Reporting of volume and revenue related product &price requirements of markets to headquarters.
• Market specific preparation of product communication (e.g., sales literature and data systems); presentations and argumentations for dealer network.
• Support of sales training and events, CIC.
• Market-specific preparation of central communication measures for customers (e.g., translations, product data) input for communicative messages.
• Responsible of alignment of product and price data with local and central controlling and sales/ aftersales department.

Qualifications and experience.
• Bachelor degree in Engineering, Business or Management Studies.
• Preferred master’s degree.
• At least 8 years working experience in automotive industry or premium brand environment.
• Leadership experience.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Negotiation skills.
• Proficient in all MS Office products.
• Fluency in English.

job_description:
Job Title:

Director, Product Management, Identity Solutions LAC

Overview:

Director, Product Management, Identity Solutions LAC

Overview
Mastercard is a global technology company in the payments industry. Our mission is to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere, by making transactions safe, simple, smart, and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships, and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments, and businesses realize their greatest potential. With connections across more than 210 countries and territories, we are building a sustainable world that unlocks priceless possibilities for all.

Mastercard’s Cyber and Intelligence solutions help to create a more secure and inclusive digital future with a range of identity, cybersecurity, and AI technologies. Identity solutions help consumers prove who they say they are, easily verifying their identity digitally across multiple touch points and improving the customer experience while also helping to detect fraudulent behavior. Cyber and Security Innovation mitigates risk within and across their business relationships, allowing organizations greater visibility into cyber threats and operational risks to reduce financial losses while saving time and resources. The AI, network, and other services make safety and security smarter and easier, helping financial institutions, merchants, governments, and other partners enhance security and convenience for everyone.

Role
This role will support the continuous development of a digital environment in which merchants and issuers exchange enhanced data through Mastercard’s Identity Check ecosystem, identify the level of risk, and ensure the person behind the transaction is who they say they are. Identity Check is a Mastercard Authentication program leveraging EMV 3DS protocol, enabling greater security and a consistent, user-friendly digital payment experience, reducing fraud, false declines, and unnecessary friction—meeting the need for simple and secure payments.

The right candidate will establish and maintain effective working relationships with internal/external stakeholders and actively support the acceleration of Identity Check adoption in the Latin American & Caribbean region. Additionally, the Director will lead strategic initiatives and execute the Identity Check product strategy, ensuring alignment with the global and regional objectives.

Specific responsibilities include:

From a product perspective:
_Identify, evaluate, and prioritize business cases for new business and product opportunities and build business models to improve Mastercard’s footprint and competitiveness.
_Support external stakeholders (e.g., issuers, acquirers, PSPs, merchants, ACSs, etc.) in properly deploying and adopting the solutions.
_Select and monitor performance metrics that assess product performance, revenue, scalability, and longevity and utilize results to ideate innovative solutions to challenges in the business unit's portfolio or product strategy.
_Develop/improve value proposition for your product suite and key customer segments.
_Lead the Product Management Excellence (PME) process to manage the delivery of ongoing innovation and enhancements.
_Partner with global, regional, and local teams to execute product management and go-to-market initiatives within supported markets.

From a commercial perspective:
_Develop and orchestrate execution of sales strategies covering, but not limited to, Identity Check, Smart Authentication solution suite, Biometric Authentication Services, and others.
_Effectively manage a pipeline of proposals from early lead stages to signature.
_Drive tangible data-driven business outcomes at the product level, manage a quantified scorecard continuously monitoring and analyzing key performance indicators, and optimize product performance.
_Work with different groups to advance and execute the strategic agenda.
_Advise and support sales & account teams by managing the product(s) pricing conversations and overseeing training development and product support materials.
_Act as an expert, advocate for, and champion designated to internal and external stakeholders.
_Responsible for the overall product financial performance of the products under responsibility

Key Qualifications
_Domain experience in authentication in the digital environment (biometrics as a differential).
_Product management experience, including translating strategies into execution and successfully getting things done.
_Superior communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
_Comfortable leveraging data to monitor performance and identify opportunities, create plans to drive usage and revenues, and prioritize resources to deliver against the plan.
_Successful track record engaging at senior levels in the organization and with partners.
_Ability to work on a team or independently and to influence and build consensus.
_Ability to work effectively under pressure and aggressive corporate targets.
_Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.
_Demonstrated intellectual curiosity, commitment to continuous learning, adaptability, and problem-solving mindset.
_Domestic and International travel up to 25%.
_English and Spanish proficiency required (Portuguese as differential)

job_description:
The Market Segment & Services Senior Specialist is a strategic professional who stays abreast of developments within own field and contributes to directional strategy by considering their application in own job and the business. Recognized technical authority for an area within the business. Requires basic commercial awareness. There are typically multiple people within the business that provide the same level of subject matter expertise. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to guide, influence and convince others, in particular colleagues in other areas and occasional external customers. Significant impact on the area through complex deliverables. Provides advice and counsel related to the technology or operations of the business. Work impacts an entire area, which eventually affects the overall performance and effectiveness of the sub-function/job family.

Responsibilities:
• Work closely with Technology, Operations and Coverage teams to drive timely, cost effective and high-quality Delivery of strategically aligned product solutions
• Partner with Finance to evaluate investments in product development, and monitor and control billing/revenue, expenditure, and benefits realization
• Work closely with global and regional product teams to develop and refine the strategy of product solutions, go to market approach, and Delivery model.
• Work with product control functions to ensure that all relevant documentation (eg product Approval Program) and processes are strictly adhered to and part of the management fabric of the product business
• Coordinate planning and other related activities for launching of new capabilities and functionalities across Technology, Operations, implementations, and regional teams
• Work closely with the coverage teams, and core product teams to ensure that demands of the White-Label clients are well understood
• develop an action plan to address VOC (Voice of the Client) feedback. Partner with cross-functional and coverage teams to execute
• Invest time to keep track of Competition, market Trends, new Technologies
• Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

Qualifications:
• 6-10 years of relevant experience in electronic banking channels with good knowledge of corporate banking practices in the cash management space; Exposure to and understanding of business analysis, data and system analysis
• Demonstrated ability to self-direct work efforts, meet deadlines, take initiative, and produce consistent high-quality work; Willingness to be a direct contributor and ability to multi-task

Education:
• Bachelor’s/University degree, Master’s degree preferred

Full time

job_description:
About you

Currently, we are looking for a Head of Product to join our growing team.

Your role is to lead the product strategy, overseeing the user experience, from conception until launch. You will be responsible for understanding complex user challenges and crafting simple solutions. You will collaborate with engineering, operations, compliance, credit risk, and marketing teams to implement and iterate on these solutions. The ideas you implement will be foundational and drive the company during its earliest stages of growth.

If you are excited about talking to users, developing solutions to complex problems, building trust with design, and helping an important, but vastly underserved segment of the Latin American economy, we are interested in talking to you.

Come join an international team of co-workers with a high degree of intellectual curiosity and passion for technology. We are seeking an experienced Product focused professional who shares our interest in using technology to make a global impact.

Responsibilities
• Build a team of talented, collaborative, and highly effective product-focused professionals, providing vision and setting the direction for the team.
• Collaborate with colleagues from Operations, Growth, and Engineering to launch features and improvements that solve user problems and grow our business.
• Lead design projects across the entire product lifecycle, from initial concept to product launch and beyond.
• Design and iterate on user flows, wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity visuals.
• Lead user research initiatives to test your designs and identify new opportunities to improve our product.
• Work closely with Engineering to build and ship features that deliver a high-quality user experience and measurable impact.
• Be actively involved in defining the team’s product strategy, collaborating with technology and business teams across the company.

We are looking for
• Experience leading a product-focused team
• 8+ years experience building best-in-class digital products
• An outstanding portfolio that showcases your UX and UI work and design process
• Strong product sensibility and deep empathy for the customer
• Expert level skills in creative software and design tools (Adobe Suite, Sketch, Invision)
• Experience managing the design process from concept development to launch
• Ability to discuss your work confidently, connecting it to larger strategic objectives as well as clearly articulating tactical and execution details
• Able to work effectively with cross-functional team members in marketing, product, and engineering
• Excellent organization, time management, and prioritization skills
• Fluent in English and Spanish or Portuguese

You will get to
• Join an early stage fintech when we are still just a few, and help us deploy scalable solutions to help the growth of SMEs in Latin America.
• You’ll be able to help us set the vision of the company and you will own product initiatives from conception to implementation.
• You’ll get to experience the entrepreneurial culture, where pushing limits and taking risks is everyday business. You’ll learn, be challenged, and have fun in the process.
• Experience open communication with management and company leadership

Benefits
• Remote first but with hybrid work options at our Mexico City office
• Competitive salary and stock options
• Flexible vacation policy
• Comprehensive health coverage: Medical, Dental and Vision
• Gym and wellness subsidy
• Monthly team events
• Awesome teammates

Contact us to know more: nuevayork@gmail.com

Stealth Startup focuses on Finance, Startups, Technology, and Finance Technology. Their company has offices in Remote. They have a small team that's between 1-10 employees.

You can view their website at https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/stealth_startup

job_description:
Jeeves is a groundbreaking financial operating system built for global businesses that provides corporate cards, cross-border payments, and spend management software within one unified platform. The company operates across 20+ countries including Brazil, Canada, Colombia, Mexico, the United Kingdom, across Europe, and the United States, and serves over 5,000 clients ranging from venture-backed startups to SMBs around the world. With a mission to empower businesses with more efficient and cost-effective financial solutions worldwide, Jeeves combines cutting-edge financial technology with exceptional team expertise to transform the business financial landscape. Jeeves has been recognized as one of The Information's 50 Most Promising Startups in 2023, as well as a Y Combinator Top Company 2021-2023 and won “Fintech of the Year" at the European Fintech Awards.

Since graduating from Y Combinator in 2020, Jeeves has successfully raised over $380 million and is backed by top world-class investors including Andreessen Horowitz, Y Combinator, CRV, Tencent, Stanford University, Clocktower Ventures, and founders of more than 15 unicorns including David Velez (Nubank), Carlos Garcia (Kavak) and Sebastián Mejía (Rappi).

We are in need of a motivated and high agency product manager to join the Product team to empower businesses with flexible and accessible credit solutions. As we expand our offerings, we are seeking a dynamic Senior Product Manager to lead our credit strategy for Jeeves Credit Underwriting. This role will focus on working within each phase of the credit product to build features that drive customer delight and maximize conversion, engagement and retention while maintaining targeted delinquency rates.

Location: This role is open to full-time remote work or an option to be based out of Mexico City, Mexico, as a hybrid position where there is an opportunity to come into our office in Roma Norte. #LI-HYBRID

What you bring to this role:
• Collaborative approach. You look to bring people together to solve problems rather than thinking for yourself.
• User-first. You always prioritize the user and make sure the products you build are both valuable and usable.
• Data driven decisions. Every decision is backed by data (both quantitative and qualitative). You take a learn-test-measure approach.
• Owner. You are the owner of the product and are accountable for its success or failure. You break down walls to ensure the product continues to drive forward.
• High-quality. You take pride in your work and have a high attention to detail. You expect the same from those you work with. You consider all of the edge cases as well as the experiences in between the core features. No pixel is less important than the next.

Job Responsibilities:
• Strategic Planning: Develop and implement a comprehensive credit strategy aligned with business goals and market dynamics.
• Risk Assessment: Evaluate the creditworthiness of businesses by analyzing financial statements, credit reports, and other relevant data sources.
• Continuous Product Development: Continuously refine and optimize credit processes to ensure efficiency, accuracy, and compliance with regulatory requirements.
• Market Analysis: Stay informed about industry trends, competitive landscape, and emerging technologies to identify new opportunities and potential risks.
• Performance Monitoring: Track key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess the effectiveness of strategies deployed and make data-driven decisions.
• Stakeholder Collaboration: Maintain open channels with key Jeeves stakeholders. Articulate findings, share pivotal updates, and ensure the broader team is always in the loop.

Requirements:
• Minimum of 5 years of experience in product management focused primarily on credit and underwriting (minimum of 3 years focused specifically on lending to medium size and enterprise businesses in Mexico or Brazil)
• Extensive knowledge of third party data sources in Mexico or Brazil to improve underwriting effectiveness or efficiency as well as proficiency in integrating these solutions
• Extensive knowledge of credit solutions available for medium size and enterprise businesses in Mexico and Brazil
• Knowledge of regulatory requirements related to business lending and credit underwriting.
• Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex financial data and make informed decisions
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders.
• Knowledge of regulatory requirements related to business lending and credit underwriting.
• Demonstrated ability to drive results in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
• Willing to work across global time zones, including 10% travel
• Solid track record of shipping and iterating on successful products with cross-functional teams
• Passion for building and executing a global bank vision

job_description:
Your Purpose

We seek a highly motivated and experienced Product Manager to lead our fraud prevention and account security initiatives. This pivotal role involves developing and implementing cutting-edge solutions to protect our users from fraudulent activities and enhance the security of their accounts. As a guardian of our users' trust and safety, you will be crucial in ensuring our platform remains secure and ahead of potential threats.

Reports To

Group Product Manager

Who You Are
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Security, Business, or related field.
• 2+ years of product management experience, preferably in fraud prevention, cybersecurity, or related areas within the financial services or crypto industry.
• Strong understanding of fraud prevention methodologies, digital security technologies, and cryptocurrency-related security challenges.
• Proven ability to lead cross-functional teams and drive project completion under tight deadlines.
• Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, with a data-driven approach to decision-making.
• Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
• Passion for cryptocurrency and commitment to user security.
• Sufficient IT knowledge to work with developers and other team roles.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and Spanish to collaborate with business and technical areas.
• High capacity to solve and analyze problems with attention to detail.
• High level of responsibility and ability to work autonomously and independently.
• Experience working with agile development practices.
• Comfortable in a fast-paced growth environment.

What You Will Do
• Strategy Development: Work with the fraud and account security business teams to craft and execute a comprehensive product strategy for fraud prevention and account security aligned with the company’s objectives and user needs.
• Product Ownership: Take full ownership of fraud prevention and account security projects from ideation through launch, including defining project scope, goals, and deliverables.
• Cross-functional Leadership: Collaborate with engineering, data science, UX/UI, legal, fraud, cybersec, infosec and compliance teams to develop and implement effective security measures.
• Market and User Research: Conduct in-depth market research and user analysis to identify emerging fraud trends and user security needs.
• Data-Driven Decision Making: Utilize data analytics to inform decisions, monitor product performance, and iterate on security features.
• Stakeholder Management: Communicate effectively with all levels of the organization and external partners to ensure alignment and buy-in on fraud prevention strategies.
• Compliance and Risk Management: Ensure all fraud prevention and account security measures comply with regulatory requirements and best practices.

Research in Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion suggests that individuals may hesitate to apply for jobs if they do not meet all the listed criteria. At Bitso, we value diversity and your unique strengths could be just what we're looking for. If this role excites you but you don't match every point in the description, we still want to hear from you.

Bitso focuses on Bitcoin, Blockchains, Mexico, and Fin Tech. Their company has offices in Mexico City. They have a mid-size team that's between 51-200 employees. To date, Bitso has raised $2.5M of funding; their latest round was closed on September 2016.

You can view their website at http://bitso.com or find them on Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, and Product Hunt.
